All Reviews

  1. Been using whitestrips for a few years now, once every six months. Simply put they work and the mild sensitivity that accompanies use with these strips is not nearly enough of a deterrent to using them given how good they work. Plus the sensitivity goes away once you finish the prescribed course of treatment, going to give the Crest HD toothpaste a try now to see how it fairs given how expensive the whitestrips are.
  2. Works great but makes teeth extra sensitive.
  3. Noticed a small difference in color, not remotely what I was hoping for or expecting. I don't plan on purchasing these again.
  4. Worked well for me. My teeth got noticeably whiter. If you're not sure if your teeth got whiter, just compare your rear teeth, which were not treated. It's not a miracle worker, so you might want to get a 2nd box.<br /><br />Now, the main annoying thing is how to deal with having these strips on your teeth. You want to apply them to dry teeth and keep them dry. Getting them wet with saliva may displace the strips, so you have several options:<br /><br />1. Keep your head tilted back and swallow your saliva.<br />2. Get a cup and spit your saliva into it.<br />3. Open your mouth and put it next to a fan to dry out your mouth.
  5. Great product great price
  6. Made my teeth sore. ..I think ill try a more natural rout
  7. These have worked very good for me, just be sure to dry your teeth somewhat before applying them.
  8. My teeth are sensitive and these made my teeth sting after only a couple of minutes of use so I had to take them off. Didn't use them after that so I can't really speak for effectiveness. But if you have sensitive teeth like me (I use Sensodyne, have sensitivity to candies and such) then I suggest you skip these.
  9. The product is great! But the package arrived bent and folded...try packing it better next time!
  10. GREAT FOR NON SMOKERS, I HAD QUIT SMOKING AND USED THE STRIPS AND MY TEETH WERE WHITE IN THREE DAYS. BUT AS SOON AS I STARTED SMOKING AGAIN ABOUT TWO MONTHS LATER IT THEY STARTED YELLOWING AGAIN BUT THE STRIPS ARE AMAZING THE ONLY THING IS THAT I DONT RECCOMEND USING THEM EVERY DAY BECOUSE THE FORMULA IS VERY STRONG AND MAY CAUSE SENSITIVITY SO BEAWARE. OTHER THAN THAT GREAT PRODUCT.
  11. My teeth are a bit yellow from a combination of coffee, tea and just genes I suppose. I had already tried previous whitening products such as CloseUp White Now, Colgate Optic White toothpaste and Oral-B Pro Health, to virtually no effect. I heard from my dentist that Crest Whitestrips is the only product that has gotten consistently positive reviews from her other patients, so I decided to purchase them as a final effort. I bought this particular variant - Crest 3D White Strips w/ Advanced Seal in 'Advanced Vivid' purely because it was the one with the most shelf space in the Crest aisle (it's probably the best seller).<br /><br />I have been using this product for only 7 days now (the pack I bought has 21 sets), and already I've seen some results. My teeth genuinely look a couple of shades lighter, not just brighter as I observed in the case of Closeup and Colgate whitening toothpastes. I also experienced little to no teeth sensitivity - with Optic White, my teeth were extremely sensitive and my lips became chapped after just one usage. I also liked how easy it is to apply the strips, and how they stay on no matter what I'm doing. In one instance I even wore them on a short grocery trip with no trouble at all.<br /><br />The only complaint I have is that there are so many different kinds of Crest whitening products that it could get quite confusing to choose. My own method was quite arbitrary because I didn't have time to consult the internet or the different labels on their packaging. I mean, even this product has at least 6 different labels on the front panel, which all have different permutations across the range. Simplify please, so it would be less intimidating for regular consumers like me to purchase and re-purchase.<br /><br />Overall, would HIGHLY recommend - but make sure you get the right Crest product that suits your needs and commitment to regimen.
  12. I took the middle of the road as far as strength and I'm so glad! Notes:<br /><br />1. My teeth are not that sensitive but I still think this strength was the strongest I'd want to use.<br />2. I'd only remember to use it about 2/week.<br />3. After using 1/3 of the box, I started getting so many comments on how white my teeth were.<br />4. The taste is awful and I watch the clock waiting to remove them.<br />5. They really stick on firmly and I have to brush my teeth immediately after removing.
  13. the package came in good conditions. Can't wait to try it out.
  14. Much better than the other kinds because it sticks to your teeth. I like to put them on when I am getting in the shower. They are much better.
  15. The strips go on easily and stay on without a problem. My dentist even asked if I had my teeth whitened professionally. I would recomment these strips to everyone. Worth the money.

  21. I purchased these crest white strips having read so many good reviews. Firstly I am 21, I do not drink, smoke, consume any caffeine or anything that overly stains the teeth. My teeth have a slight yellow tint and I just wanted them to be lightened at least 2 shades. I used the strips as instructed for the 14 days.<br /><br />My teeth became extremely sensitive! I never suffer from sensitive teeth but this was horrendous I could not even drink luke warm water. I had to go and purchase a whole array of sensitive toothpaste/mouthwash etc. SO not only did I have to pay a lot for shipping (to England) but I also had to fork out on special toothpaste.<br /><br />My teeth did not lighten at all! And I literally mean not even by one shade. I was flabbergasted that I had spent all this money to then have horrible sensitivity to come out with teeth no whiter than in the beginning. I am so disappointed with these and would not recommend anyone to spend their money on them. You would probably have more luck spending £5 at your local pharmacy.<br /><br />I will not be purchasing any crest products in the future, what a let down.
  22. I've tried the more intense Crest strips before, and they left my mouth numb, burning, and aching for the following days (but they sure whitened!). These, however, are fantastic for sensitive teeth! My now-husband and I shared the box for the week leading up to our wedding. The change was not drastic, but it was noticeable to us. Of course, we split the box, so neither of us got the full effect. Next time I would go up on notch in intensity, but I believe that 30 minutes is a perfect amount of time to dedicate to this in a day. Any more and the pain and sensitivity start to kick in.
  23. Crest has always worked for me but had trouble keeping the strips in place for the full time. These strips are great and stay on your teeth. In fact, your really have to pull to get these off. Love them!

  29. This product really works! Strangers are always complimenting me on how white my teeth are!
  30. I bought the strips because of the good reviews it received. I have been a coffee drinker for over 40 years and I was shocked when I saw a close up picture of my teeth. I purchased it and used it twice a day as recommended for someone with my degree of \\"stains.\\" There was a noticeable difference in 3 or 4 days and even my husband commented on it. Now my teeth are not sparkling white and never were and never will be but they are so much better looking. I had no pain with this product. I did find it easy to use but had one problem with my lower teeth. I have somewhat crooked teeth on the bottom and the strip did not hold as well as with the upper teeth but this was due to my teeth and not the strips. As a result of my experience my husband is now using them (once a day) with noticeable success. One comment I purchased the strips from Amazon on Sept.14, '09 for $28.98 and I notice the price is now $30.25 but still less expensive than retail.
  31. I have used the white strips before the advanced white strips came out. They tasted disgusting and would not stick to my teeth. They really didn't improve the color of my teeth either. When I heard they came out with new strips that were supposed o stay on better and not taste so bad I had to try them. I don't smoke but I do drink coffee everyday, sometimes numerous times daily. After the first time I used the strips to my surprise, I definitely noticed an improvement. I have been using them now for over a week and my teeth are drastically whiter. They stick very well and the taste is not overwhelming. On the bad side they do make your teeth a bit sensitive so I cut down to every other day instead of once a day. I would highly recommend using them.
  32. I'm about halfway through the 14 days, and I love these! I can see a very noticeable difference in the color of my teeth already. They stay on great, and are not annoying to have on like many other whitening products. I've used the aquafresh white trays before and those were awful, oozed out the whitening gel (which burned my lips) tasted awful, and were torture to keep in for 30 minutes. Sometimes when I wear these I have the slight urge to gnash my teeth, but other than that they are not bad to have on. My teeth were a little sensitive to cold drinks on about the 5th day, so I skipped one day and now they're fine. All in all I am very satisfied with the white strips.
  33. The product worked as advertised -- one 30 minute application per day for two weeks and my teeth really are whiter.
  34. These are just amazing. The new versions adhere to the teeth much better, making it easier to wear them for 30 minutes. The results, even after just the first treatment is just amazing.
  35. The product works really good. I saw my teeth a lot whiter after one week. The only thing not good about it was my teeth started feeling really sensitive and uncomfortable after about one week use of the strips.
  36. I used this product three times. First time I used this strips it was okey. The second time was a disaster. I felt acute pain in my teeth soon after I removed the strips from my teeth. I didn't know right away that the Crest strips were the culprit and was blaming the citrus flavor mouthwash that I used in the morning. I didn't use the strips for a couple of days. By this time I didn't feel good about using these strips in my teeth. Two days later I used the strips on my teeth again. This time soon after I removed the strips from my teeth I got the most severe pain in my teeth. I took four painkillers and still the pain didn't subside. I couldn't sleep properly due to the acute sensitivity in my teeth. Fortunately it was the Saturday night and I could sleep the next day.<br />I will never use these kinds of strips again. It was the worst feeling I felt in my teeth.
  37. These strips work pretty well at removing stains, but they are simply not long enough and don't cover nearly enough teeth, at least not for a guy - they may be ok for women or anybody else with a really tiny mouth. The bottom strips are much, much too short - they're about half the length of the top ones, which are already on the short side. Making them longer would undoubtably make them slightly more difficult to insert and remove, but the additional coverage and cleaning would be worth it, especially for men. For those with smaller mouths, they could easily be trimmed to length with scissors. As it is, the teeth you see through parted lips (like during conversation) directly from the front will normally be whitened fairly well, but those a little further back and slightly to the side, which are clearly visible from the front and profile during a wider grin or laugh, will still be covered in whatever stains you were trying to remove.<br /><br />I had no issues with pain or increased sensitivity with these. I did find them a little difficult to remove - they adhere well once you've got them on. In my mind, that's a fair trade-off for being able to forget about them and not having to worry about them moving around while you go do other things for 30 - 40 minutes before taking them out.<br /><br />C'mon, Crest - what fraction of a penny would it have cost you to make these strips a half-inch longer?
  38. After using the 3D Advanced Vivid Whitestrips, I saw an improvement in the color of my teeth after just four uses. This is a great product, and after my order runs out in five days, I will more than likely request a second box from Amazon. However, before you order this product, there are a few things that you need to consider.<br /><br />1.) Though this product works, it is nothing special. This whitening device is simply an adhesive strip of peroxide that bonds firmly to your teeth, and you can get the same whitening result by rinsing your mouth daily with hydrogen peroxide from the grocery store.<br /><br />2.) If you have a peroxide sensetivity, stay away from this product. Some people experience a burning sensation on their gums during usage, so I recommend rinsing with regular household peroxide to test your sensetivity before you spend $20-$30 on these whitestrips.<br /><br />3.) As Crest promises, these whitestrips DO NOT slip off of your teeth while you are using them. In fact, when I used them for the first time, I panicked a little when my 30 minutes were up. The strips become extremely sticky and slimy during usage, so it is almost impossible to peel them off of the front side of your teeth. I recommend pulling them off from the back of your teeth first, and though you might feel a slightly painful tug on the front of your teeth, it goes away quickly.<br /><br />4.) If you are going to apply these whitestrips, you MUST use a mirror to do so! It is important to place the strips RIGHT AT YOUR GUM LINE, or else you will get funky results. If you have any creases in the strip, that crease will show up on your teeth. When I used them for the first time, I did so without a mirror, and I had a thin horizontal white stripe in the center of all of my teeth. Though these lines disappear, it was very unsightly for awhile.<br /><br />5.) The immediate after math of using the whitestrips is not always pretty. First of all, the strips leave a thin gunky residue on your teeth, so it is important to brush afterwards. Also, the strips sometimes leave white spots or lines on the teeth. These spots are only temporary, but I do not recommmend using them right before you have to go somewhere important.<br /><br />Overall, I recommend this product. If you apply the Crest 3D Advanced Vivid Whitestrips according to the instructions on the included leaflet, you should see dramatically whiter teeth after you have used all of the packets in your box.r teeth, so it is important to brush afterwards. Also, the strips sometimes leave white spots or lines on the teeth. These spots are only temporary, but I do not recommmend using them right before you have to go somewhere important.<br /><br />Overall, I recommend this product. If you apply the Crest 3D Advanced Vivid Whitestrips according to the instructions on the included leaflet, you should see dramatically whiter teeth after you have used all of the packets in your box.
  39. I use an electric toothbrush and brush and floss my teeth daily. However, I love coffee and Diet Coke, and over the past few years my teeth have suffered the consequences. They were quite yellow, and no amount of brushing was making a difference in whitening. So I decided to try the Crest Strips, since they were far less expensive than a professional whitening by the dentist. I could tell a difference after two days of using the strips as directed and within a week my smile is significantly whiter. My only complaint is that I wish the strips were a bit bigger, especially on the top. That said, they have done a great job of removing stains from dark beverages. I have otherwise healthy teeth, and I suffered no pain or irritation from the strips. If you have similar stains, I recommend giving them a try!

  53. They absolutely do work.<br /><br />Here is how I whiten the sides that do not get covered by the strips.<br /><br />The outside of the perforated area on the strip, the part of the strip you throw out, use. I just cut up and place them on the teeth towards the back.<br /><br />You should also do this to whiten the back of your teeth. Believe it or not, any stains on the back of the teeth can effect the level of whiteness you see on the front.<br /><br />I also pay extra attention to my eye teeth by placing these cut up pieces on at times I am not whitening with the entire strip.

  57. I went through the Amazon warehouse option, to qualify for the shipping discounts. Shipping costs are eating me alive, in the necessities I must find online, because on a native reservation many of these products are unavailable, which i think is a socio economic barrier easily tagged as corporate racism by those of us who experience this.<br /><br />I ordered the 28 count, and received the 14 count. Which is pretty substantial considering the price. Amazon does not accept returns of health and beauty products, and had i been forced to return it, add in the gas, mileage and time to repackage and return the product, I probably would have been so upset I might have stopped using amazon. however, amazon realized the mistake and comp'ed the items, but it may not be their policy since its difficult to contact them in the first place re: orders that are placed that are delivered, same manufacturer same product but different qty or description nuance.<br /><br />Anyways, I'm really more concerned about the product itself and the variations Crest markets, which I find particularly deceptive, when their products have remarkable effectiveness. In particular, if you look for a 3d white strip, and don't also make sure the product identifiers are correct, you could end up with any number of variations like in the \\"Advanced Vivid\\", description. The Advanced Vivid product, has a much smaller upper strip. And it seems they are sizing down all their strips in general.<br /><br />First I want to say, that the strips aren't long enough in the first place to cover back and front teeth. Some ppl may like dingy back teeth but I don't. The box is huge, compared to the strips, and that doesn't say much for consumer waste packaging.<br /><br />I don't mind the thick seal or the difficulty getting the product off, because I'd much rather that then when they slide or fall off.<br /><br />If they went back to the container, that holds the strips, - actually one that was smaller, like for a purse or wallet, like a business card sized container, to hold the strips, they'd be much better of a convenience use for folks like me.packaging.<br /><br />I don't mind the thick seal or the difficulty getting the product off, because I'd much rather that then when they slide or fall off.<br /><br />If they went back to the container, that holds the strips, - actually one that was smaller, like for a purse or wallet, like a business card sized container, to hold the strips, they'd be much better of a convenience use for folks like me.

  61. I bought this probably about a month ago off Amazon. I got a really great deal because there was a 7 dollar coupon it let me use as well (thanks Amazon!). So my first suggestion would be to look at the price online first before going into the store to buy it. I looked at my local Walmart to compare the price and it was almost a 20 dollar difference! Anyways, to the product. I have used some of the old Crest Whitestrips before, not sure what kind, but it was about 3 years ago so one would assume that Crest would create a product of better quality. So, I began looking at the reviews on Amazon and many people were raving at the Crest 3D White Advanced Vivid Whitestrips. The only problem I saw in people's reviews was that they were not great for people with sensitive teeth, which would be me. However, this was such a great deal, I couldn't turn it down. So, I began using them about a month ago (I know the kit says it's a 14 day supply, I'll get to that) and I can definitely see a difference. So, the package says there are 14 upper and 14 lower strips, which would equate to use over 14 days. But, as all the people in reviews said, they really do create a lot of sensitivity. I have very sensitive teeth, I use Sensodine for my teeth (At first used it for a month continuously, then now it's about every other day). So, my regime was to use a days strip and then wait a few days (2-3, depending on how my teeth felt) until I used the next one. I found this worked quite well. So, if you have sensitive teeth but yet still want to use a whitestrip, I would suggest doing what I did. Also, they really, REALLY do stay on! Almost too well. I find myself ripping them off my teeth to get them off! However, I shouldn't complain because this was a big improvement from the other whitestrips I used. So, overall, a great product that does make a difference. Don't expect to have a completely new smile or you will be highly disappointed.
  62. I received a sample of these strips with my most recent toothpaste purchase and figured I'd give them a try. I generally whiten using the dentist grade gel and trays, but experience a lot of sensitivity when I do and have to reduce my whitening time quite a bit. I didn't notice any sensitivity while using the Crest product. My teeth lighten fairly well anyway, but I noticed a considerable difference in the brightness of my smile after just the first use. The gel seeps and the strips wrinkle, but I am very pleased with the results of this product overall.
  63. Easy to apply and use, excellent results, with teeth noticeably brightened.
  64. These are the only strips I will use, because they work efficiently and stick well to the teeth while processing! Always get compliments on my pearl whites, even from dentists :)
  65. For reference, this is the first time I've ever attempted to whiten my teeth. I drink coffee and soda occasionally (1-2x a week or every other week.) I am also Asian, so a lot of my meals include sauces that can stain teeth (i.e. soy and duck sauce). My teeth also have a bit of worn out enamel.<br /><br />PROS:<br />- Easy to use<br />- Effective (lightened my teeth about one shade)<br />- After taste not that strong (the after taste wasn't bad, but I experienced a phlegm like buildup when I swallowed the foam. So after the first day, I decided to spit out my saliva every 5-min while using these).<br /><br />CONS:<br />- Instructions too vague (didn't mention when you should eat/drink/brush teeth. In my case, I waited 1-hr after/before eating to use this and brushed my teeth afterwards).<br />- Lower strip too small (it would be nice if it covered more teeth; it covered 6 teeth for me but only the 4 middle teeth actually whitened).<br />- Tooth sensitivity (I did experience sensitivity for the 1st week; it wasn't so bad the 2nd week. It felt like my teeth were weak, kind of like when you first have your braces removed or when you first use a retainer -- I couldn't drink really cold or hot drinks / chew on hard food).
  66. The strips for the lower teeth are too long. I could not install them without them getting stuck on the sides of the mouth opening.
  67. I scoured the reviews of all the whitening products before settling on the Advanced White Strips and must admit I was initially thrilled:<br /><br />Day 1 - tiny improvement<br />Day 2 - teeth went from dingy white to a much brighter white<br />Day 3 - dramatic improvement -- teeth were almost chalk white and I was stunned.<br /><br />Now, for a pause...<br /><br />Day 4 - teeth didn't get whiter and appeared slightly less bright<br />day 5 - teeth definitely looked less white<br />day 6 - less white<br />day 7 - less white<br />day 8 - teeth remained this medium white and NEVER went back to the dazzling white they were on day 3. I discontinued using the product on day 10.<br /><br />I'm not sure why this product stopped working after day 3 and I also can't account for why it made my teeth look less white after day 5. I can't recommend it because my teeth are not the color of: sugar, styrofoam, xerox paper, Easter bunnies or marshmellows. After using Advanced Seal Whitestrips they are the color of: sheer white curtains that haven't been washed all year, seagulls that have been stomping and splashing around on a muddy shore and a squashed bar of Ivory soap that you might find in the restroom of a roadside diner...
  68. These white strips aren't going anywhere. They stay firmly on teeth and the bleaching agent doesn't seep out and make me gag like the original version of white strips. Give them a try. They are worth the extra money.
  69. I have used all the Crest products leading up to these, and 'Advanced Seal' has by far been my favorite one. The 'Classic' and 'Pro' both worked as they were supposed to, but the way they were made, they would kind of unstick from your teeth with the saliva and hydrogen peroxide gel bubbling, so I would constantly be trying to re adhere them. The gel would dissolve in the saliva also, so there was always a weird medicinal flavor--not so unpleasant that it deterred me from continuing, but bad enough that 'Advanced Seal' felt like a huge step up. 'Advanced Seal' neither peeled off nor released any off-flavors in my mouth.<br /><br />I also tried the Aquafresh trays, and they were HORRIBLE. The trays are one-size-fits-all and I would like to know who has front teeth 1/4 inch wide. The gel goes everywhere and stays on your teeth for no time. For people that experience mild gum sensitivity from putting the Crest strips, the Aquafresh trays are a nightmare! I received no results, was in pain the entire box, and had essentially threw away my money. In afterthought, I should have thrown the stuff away after trying the first one!<br /><br />I had tooth sensitivity issues with the 'Pro' but not with 'Classic' or 'Adavanced Seal', meaning, for 'Pro' some of my teeth felt sore, which is a weird feeling, but it only occurred if I did the recommended 2 a day--cutting down to 1 eliminated all the problems. All of them whitened about the same--noticeable to people I knew, but not totally fake-looking either, just the right shade of white.<br /><br />So, to summarize, the whitening strips I've liked best have been the 'Classic' and the 'Advanced Seal'.<br /><br />'Classic' is the mildest of the strips I've tried, so people with sensitive teeth or gums would probably do best with them. They are the least expensive, but they also take 28 days (twice a day) to whiten. They don't stick as strongly as 'Advanced Seal', but eventually do work just as well, for around half the price.<br /><br />'Advanced Seal' is just a more streamlined version of 'Premium'--just as good in 1/4 the time, with much less effort to keep them on. If you've got the money, I loved 'Advanced Seal' and will buy it again when my teeth need whitening again!ice.<br /><br />'Advanced Seal' is just a more streamlined version of 'Premium'--just as good in 1/4 the time, with much less effort to keep them on. If you've got the money, I loved 'Advanced Seal' and will buy it again when my teeth need whitening again!

  77. Crest Whitestrips Advanced Seal<br />Quite Impressive even when compared to Pro products<br /><br />I am making this comparison to Opalescence 35% professional gel that I used in dental trays about a year ago. That was I believe the highest concentration of hydrogen peroxide (the common bleaching agent used in pretty much all the whitening products) readily available through mail order. They also offer 15% and 20% I think. At the time I went overboard testing its effectiveness by taking photos of my teeth before and after each treatment under fixed white balance setting and comparing the results with the color picker tool in a drawing program. Yes it worked and it worked well. However filling the tray was a pain and remaining pretty much motionless for half hour at a time was more of a pain. Add to that the fact that your mouth is constantly producing saliva, which you do not want to swallow so it drools down your cheek. Sorry for the graphics but to be helpful with the review I feel its important that you understand the do it yourself alternatives. My teeth color is only very slightly off white due to tea, coffee and wine. I would have to repeat the treatment about every three months to keep a natural (not bright) white appearance. After I ran out of Opalescence, I did not re order due to the involved treatment procedures. Hence the White strips. The regular , not \\"advanced\\", products are just as much of a pain due to the fact that they will not stay on. The advanced strips stick on like Velcro. I usually dry my teeth with a paper towel first to make sure the bond is good, and have had them stick for an hour with no problem. As soon as you stick the strips on you can see the foaming hydride start to do its work. Surprisingly I found the whitening achieved after 1 hour (30 min recommended) to be a close equivalent of the pro gel. There is no peroxide concentration spelled out anywhere on or in the box so I would guess that it is below the 15% offered in pro products, but the close proximity of the gel to the teeth without any saliva dilution makes up for some of that. Crest recommends that initially you should use them twice a day for best/fastest results, I would agree with that. I use the strips to maintain the color only now, so one application (out of the 14 sets in box) per month will last a year. Crest recommends that you use two entire kits of 14 per year. Here are additional things you should know:<br /><br />1. Not one of the 14 foil packs containing the strips opened up correctly by pulling where the arrow shows. It rips above the seal. Don't try to do it from the other side, just get scissors.<br />2. The top strip is just 5/8 by 3 inches long. That is too short in the up and down direction for me. I have to start applying the strip at the top of the teeth by the gum and there is hardly any left to wrap around to the back of the teeth. Another 1/8\\" please?<br />3. After you apply the top and bottom strip, gently use the tips of your fingernails to push in the strips between the teeth. Quite often these areas are most discolored.<br />4. If you have any tartar buildup, have it removed/scraped first. The contrast between it and tooth enamel will be exaggerated by the whitening process.<br />5. When its time to remove the strips, it is a bit of an ordeal. They really stick very well, but do peel off easily if you start at a corner and youse your fingernails for a good grip. When the strip comes off, there will be remnants of the glue and gel stuck on your teeth. Don't panic, but I wish the instructions would have mentioned this. It will dissolve completely after about 5 minutes.<br />6. I had no tooth sensitivity issues at all., but the close proximity of the gel to the teeth without any saliva dilution makes up for some of that. Crest recommends that initially you should use them twice a day for best/fastest results, I would agree with that. I use the strips to maintain the color only now, so one application (out of the 14 sets in box) per month will last a year. Crest recommends that you use two entire kits of 14 per year. Here are additional things you should know:<br /><br />1. Not one of the 14 foil packs containing the strips opened up correctly by pulling where the arrow shows. It rips above the seal. Don't try to do it from the other side, just get scissors.<br />2. The top strip is just 5/8 by 3 inches long. That is too short in the up and down direction for me. I have to start applying the strip at the top of the teeth by the gum and there is hardly any left to wrap around to the back of the teeth. Another 1/8\\" please?<br />3. After you apply the top and bottom strip, gently use the tips of your fingernails to push in the strips between the teeth. Quite often these areas are most discolored.<br />4. If you have any tartar buildup, have it removed/scraped first. The contrast between it and tooth enamel will be exaggerated by the whitening process.<br />5. When its time to remove the strips, it is a bit of an ordeal. They really stick very well, but do peel off easily if you start at a corner and youse your fingernails for a good grip. When the strip comes off, there will be remnants of the glue and gel stuck on your teeth. Don't panic, but I wish the instructions would have mentioned this. It will dissolve completely after about 5 minutes.<br />6. I had no tooth sensitivity issues at all.

  92. I've used Crest Whitestrip products for years now and have always been satisfied with them. They clean well, don't taste bad and were easy to use. The only drawback I every encountered was their tendency on occasion to fall off before you were ready for them to go. Well it looks like Crest was listening. These new strips have the same cleaning properties but stay put until you're ready to remove them. Perfect!
  93. For years I have always wanted to try whitening strips so I could improve the shade of my teeth. They aren't overly stained but after many years of drinking coffee every morning, and at various times throughout the day, they could be a few shades lighter. So, when I got the chance to try out these new Crest Advances Seal whitestrips, I was excited to give them a shot.<br /><br />Let me tell you that once you put these on there are no worries of these strips coming off unless you physically take them off yourself. I found that sometimes I would have to use a little extra effort than normal to remove a strip but this did not happen all the time. And on occassion there was a slight sticky residue left on my teeth after removing the strips. Unlike some, I did not experience any problems with burning on my gums. But the instructions clearly state that if you do have sensitivity problems that you may feel some discomfort. After a few days of using the strips I could visibly notice the change in color of my teeth. They were looking whiter and they looked good. Also let me add that if you are going to use this product you are not supposed to keep drinking coffee or other items that can stain your teeth. Nor are you supposed to smoke. If you do these things the strips may not work properly.<br /><br />Now the price is a bit steep, but it is a lot cheaper than having your teeth professionally cleaned. And this only takes 30 minutes out of your day. Seems like a pretty good value in the long run. And as another reviewer mentioned enclosed is a $7 coupon of your next purchase which is a great bonus.
  94. These new strips actually do what they say! They adhere to the teeth, making it easy for the gel to do it's work. They are also easy to handle, which is a bonus for anyone who's ever tried whitestrips.<br />What I didn't like was the flavor, not the best. But more than that. The gel clings to the teeth even after you remove the strips and leaves the taste in your mouth for a while. That's the reason for only 4 stars. Otherwise, great product and I would definitely recommend.
  95. I drink my tea or coffee black,and enjoy a glass of wine from time to time and they do tend to discolor my teeth.<br />I found the strips to be an effective way to remove the stains and whiten my teeth.Is it as good as a cleaning at my dentist ? No,but it sure costs less.They are also a bit hard to get on with out wrinkling and can be hard to remove as they do stick to your teeth, but nothing that can not be overcome.I feel they do help to keep my teeth white and as I work with the public that is very important.My husband just said to be sure to say they keep me quite for a half hour..As the do tend to be a bit slippery I keep my mouth closed for the 30 minutes.
  96. I have been using Crest Whitestrips for over a year now. Before using the Whitestrips, I used a dentist-made bleaching tray and Opalescence in syringes. I feel that the Whitestrips are easier to use, and I didn't have to leave them on as long as the bleaching trays. Both had similar whitening results. If I don't use the Whitestrips for a month or so, I notice that my teeth begin to lose the whiteness, so I try to use one about once every week or even two weeks to maintain. Make sure, if you purchase them, to check the expiration date on the box. If it is a date that has passed, don't buy them. The strips will probably have lost some of their potency. I would recommend this product if you want to try to whiten your teeth on your own.

  102. one can do it in the shower...<br /><br />A box of Crest Whitestrips, Advanced Seal, 14-Count Boxes comes with 14 packets that includes 1 upper and 1 lower strip. Use once daily.<br /><br />The strips are easy to apply to the center upper and lower teeth.<br /><br />It does however feel like I have plastic in my mouth -- which is good because one might forget to take them out, otherwise.<br /><br />The saliva buildup is increased while wearing the strips causing one to swallow or spit prior to the 30 minutes. After the allotted time, the strips become mushy and therefore a bit harder to remove.<br /><br />For me it was hard to enunciate words clearly with the strips on my teeth -- just say no to the cell phone or major political speeches for 30 minutes. :)<br /><br />Smile! After using the Whitestrips for 14 days, my center upper and lower teeth are noticeably whiter -- lots of compliments! --Katharena Eiermann, 2009

  117. YOU SHOULD TOTALLY BUY THESE WHITESTRIPS IF YOU REALLY WANT WHITER TEETH. Don't whine about sensitivity, it says right on the box that it can happen. I had no issue with the \\"goo\\" on these bleaching my clothes or fingers. They only became gooey when I removed them from my teeth.<br /><br />I had been thinking about whitening my teeth for awhile -- I had the Rembrandt 2-Hour Whitening kit, but that thing TORE MY GUMS UP. It did whiten my teeth slightly though, but not worth the $50 and the pain. I asked my dentist about getting professional whitening, but he said it's basically the same thing as everything out on the market that has a tray (like the rembrandt kit), just wildly more expensive (I love his honesty).<br /><br />I had the old whitestrips from about 3 years ago -- they didn't do too much for me. I got this new set of Crest Whitestrips in a fit of optimism. The shipping took a little longer than most stuff I get from Amazon, but nothing outrageous. The packaging was nothing to hoot at (mine came wrapped in the Classifieds section in a manila envelope, the box was a little crushed, but the innards were fine).<br /><br />I read the instructions, and DID NOT brush my teeth beforehand, and slapped those suckers onto my lower and upper teeth. I like these better than the old whitestrips, they aren't gooey and slippery like the old ones. They're more a tacky feel, like they get sticky only when they get wet, so you can readjust them without them sliding all over your mouth. I do have a fairly wide smile, and the upper strips cover just about all of it, and the lower ones cover about 6 of my teeth. These don't taste as bleachy as the old ones, and they didn't irritate my gums AT ALL either.<br /><br />I've been using them every other day to cut back on the risk of sensitivity (but I fell asleep with them on one day, which you're NOT supposed to do - so i ended up leaving em on for like 2 hours instead of just 30 minutes, so I had some sensitivity after that session that faded eventually). I noticed a visible difference in the shade of my teeth within 3-4 treatments and I think i still have about 5 packets left. My teeth are pretty white now, but not unnaturally white (by unnatural, i mean like Ross in that episode of Friends where he dates the girl with the blacklight). My teeth aren't paper-white, but let's be honest -- that would be creepy. The walls at my job are a pale cream color, and my teeth are now whiter than the walls.<br /><br />The only thing that could make these better is if they paid my bills and told me they loved me once in awhile.<br />Oh, and maybe included a whitening scale, so that you could compare your teeth when you start to when you finish.n that faded eventually). I transformed my smile from yellowish coffee grunge to fabulous illuminating white after about 3 straight months of using crest white strips with advanced seal.   138. Most of the whitening products I have used in the past are paint on types and usually lead to excessive salivating while I try my best to keep from removing the whitener from my teeth. The top strip covers a large portion of my teeth however I feel like in order to get good coverage of all of your teeth such as the sides and cracks between teeth, you have to produce a little bit of suction to pull the strip closer to your teeth. Otherwise, I would feel like the strip would only cover the front of the teeth well.<br /><br />The package recommends applying it once per day and recommends not using it directly after brushing your teeth. I don't think that it is incredibly noticeable so I've often started my day brushing my teeth then preparing my lunch and other needs for the day and approximately 30 minutes later I apply the strip right before I head out the door. With my 20 minute commute on the bus I've found that nobody has ever commented on it and only noticed it when I asked if they could still see the strip.<br /><br />The strip stays on very well and although I have never personally experienced strips sliding around there is little chance that these strips will move. Removal will be a bit more difficult but I think that its worth it knowing that the chemical will be directly applied to my teeth and not slowly lost in my saliva. To remove I often have to approach it from different angles because I don't want it to affect my crown. Because crowns won't change color I haven't used it for more than 5 days in a row so that I can get somewhat brighter teeth without bringing too much attention to the difference in color from my crown.<br /><br />I did see results after 3 or 4 days so that claim I believe is true. Her teeth look movie star white, so I really don't think she needs the full 14 days, although I think I could use a couple more days to maybe get a shade or two lighter on a few hard to reach teeth. The advance seal works very well for adhering to those problem teeth that may not be perfectly inline with the adjacent teeth. Just push the strip onto any teeth not perfectly in line and the strip will stay sealed to contour over the adjacent teeth. Amazon's price was perfect and 2 day shipping got it to my door in 1 day.

  173. Let me start by saying that I smoke, drink red wine and drink tea. I use whitening tooth paste (not any one in particular) daily. I am a religious whitening strip user every 6 months. People used to always tell me that I had beautiful teeth but since I started using these, the compliments are unbelievable. I was even told that my teeth are movie star white.<br /><br />The strips are very easy to put on. I start in the front so that I can push the strips into every nook and cranny of the teeth. I then work my way to the back, then fold the bottom under, making sure to again push the strips into every section. It sounds like alot but it only takes about a minute.<br /><br />They stay on so great! I usually keep them on while I'm getting ready in the morning, so I end up leaving then on about 30-40 minutes. They can be a bit messy when taking them off but having a tissue handy will solve that. I like to rinse with mouthwash after removing them to get any excess gel off.<br /><br />My teeth were only sensitive one time. I fell asleep with them on for about 4 hours. My teeth were sensitive for about 24 hours but were completely back to normal afterwards.

  196. I purchased this after using Target Up & Up Brand whitening strips for two weeks. The Target brand did a good job, but I wanted to see if the name-brand would make my teeth whiter. Here are my thoughts.<br /><br />1. Honestly, I can't tell if these made my teeth any whiter. To be fair, the two weeks with the Target brand doing a good job made the comparison of &#34;before Crest&#34; and &#34;after Crest&#34; harder to evaluate. I do, however, think that the Crest strips were *working*.<br /><br />2. The Crest strips were thicker and easier to put into my mouth. This gave them more rigidity so that wrapping them around my teeth was easier. Especially the Target bottom strip was so flexible that it sometimes got folded over and didn't give a good fit. If it *did* go in straight, the fit was fine.<br /><br />3. The Target brand strips were much thinner and easier to remove. I thought the Target strips stayed in place very well, but if you are concerned about the strips sliding, get the Crest ones. They stick so well that they take a little work to remove them. Not a problem, they just stick more completely.<br /><br />4. The Target top strip was a little smaller and the bottom strip was a littler larger. I found that I liked the size of the Crest top strip and the Target bottom strip better.<br /><br />5. I found the Target strips hard to get out of the package. The Crest strips came out of the package very easily. In all fairness, my wife used the Target strips from a second box and did not have this problem.<br /><br />I know that this is more than just a review of the Crest White Strips, but I was looking for this kind of review when I bought my first set. I wanted to know if it was worth the extra cost for the brand name.<br /><br />In my opinion, it *could* be worth the extra cost due to the ease if inserting and the firm grip, but the smaller bottom strip that Crest provides concerns me a little. I thought the size was borderline.<br /><br />The recommendation is to use these strips occasionally to keep the whiteness &#34;touched up&#34;. I would say that if the Crest strips are not too much more expensive, I will probably buy them. I got a very good price from Amazon for the Crest Strips so cost wouldn't be much of an issue.commendation is to use these strips occasionally to keep the whiteness &#34;touched up&#34;.   198. I've tried numerous tooth bleaching products over the years. None of the tooth pastes work. Crest white strips were the best I've found, a fact confirmed by consumer reports recently. However, I hated them because, as other reviewers have noted, the strips did not stick to teeth sufficiently and moved around or came off during treatment. Having to fool with them constantly basically made it impossible to do anything else while the treatment was in progress. These Advanced Seal strips totally solve that problem. They adhere much better with a thicker stickier peroxide gel. The lower strip is also shaped in a way that helps it stay in place -- the outer upper edges of the lower strip are trimmed so that they do not wrap over the molers. This was where the worst of the dislocation occurred with the old strips. With this new design the strips stay put, and the gel stays put, and the gel gets to work on the tooth. Whitening follows. Great! While the strips are slightly harder to remove, its no big deal and well worth the benefit of having them stay where the are supposed to be for each 1/2 hour session.
  199. These strips work pretty well at whitening your teeth. They go on fairly easy, adhering and molding to your teeth, and are comfortable. I saw increased whitening for the first week, but it didn't remove all stains and after one week I saw no further whitening. I would use these for a week and then use them less often to re-whiten. After a week has expired, I would use the remaining strips to maintain the whiteness for awhile. If you drink a lot of cola, tea, or coffee, like I do, your teeth will quickly be re-stained. Therefore, using a week's worth of strips and then storing the rest to re-whiten your teeth later is probably the best way to use these. The amount of whitening hits a wall after about a week. At least it did for me... These are relatively cheap though and worth the money.

  208. I've tried the regular Crest Whitestrips in the past, but never managed to get through a whole box because they annoyed me. They slipped around a lot and tasted terrible.<br />These, however, are a whole different story! They stay put. Really, they don't move. As one reviewer noted, there is a lot of glue (or whatever the sticky stuff is)! But I can almost forget I'm wearing them, because they don't move. They are more difficult to remove. I grab them with a tissue, and that helps hold them while I pull them off. A quick brush or rinse gets rid of any leftover gook. And there is less gook, I find, then I had with the old Whitestrips.<br />I am on the last strip today (wearing while I write this!), and my teeth have started to feel sensitive. I started using Sensodyne a few days ago, and hopefully the sensitivity will fade (as stated in the Whitestrips directions).<br />As for whitening, they did do the job. My teeth aren't blinding, but they have certainly improved, and that's good enough for me. One problem is that they don't whiten between teeth, which can leave the crevices looking even more stained. I found that I could fix that problem to some extent by pushing the strip into those spots with my finger nail, kind of conforming the strip to all parts of the teeth, instead of just the front.<br />Since a nice coupon was included, I will definately buy another box of these, although I'll probably wait a month before I do another round of whitening.
  209. I had tried to use the original whitestrips before. However, I could not make it through the recommended 14 days because it kept moving around and I could taste the whitening formula on the tongue and was just overall irritating to wear.<br /><br />I saw these new ones and though I should give it a try. It did not do so earlier but it resulted in me having to rinse my mouth to get some of the gunk out<br /><br />Overall, it's a vast improvement to the old whitestrips and it did what it said it would.   210. As a person that consumes large amounts of coffee and tea, keeping my teeth white has been an ongoing struggle that has prompted me to buy just about every whitening product available. Every time Crest comes out with a new Whitestrips product I give it a try. Many have been disappointing, and all have proven to be a somewhat unpleasant chore to use. Now I understand that doing something to make your teeth whiter is worth some time and effort, but using the Crest Whitestrips is usually a messy, uncomfortable process that I have always dreaded. Still, I have always been able to get noticeable results so I continue to use them nonetheless. Until recently I was getting the best results from using the Crest Whitestrips Pro Effects 10-day System. However, those strips still tended to slide around on my teeth and required that I keep my mouth closed for the entire treatment.<br /><br />In February I was given the opportunity to try the new Crest Advanced Seal Whitestrips kit. It is certainly a big improvement over the other Whitestrips products. The Advanced Seal kit only requires a 30 minute treatment once a day, whereas the rest of the Whitestrips product line requires two 30 minute treatments each day. The entire kit lasts for 14 days, but it promises that you will see results within 3 days. The kit contains 14 packets, each packet containing an upper and lower whitening strip. Each strip is coated with a peroxide-infused gel, which is claimed to mold and adhere to teeth better that any previous Whitestrips product. Crest also notes that this product will only work on natural teeth, and will NOT whiten caps, crowns, veneers, fillings, or dentures. These Whitestrips should not be used by anyone under the age of 12, and should not be used on teeth with braces. Crest even claims that you can drink water while whitening your teeth with this product.<br /><br />Here is the 3-step method for using this product (taken directly from the Crest website):<br /><br />1. Peel:<br />- For best results, do not brush teeth immediately before applying strips.<br />- Open foil pouch and remove.<br />- Peel strips from backing.<br />2. Apply:<br />- Apply gel side of strip to teeth. It will instantly mold and adhere to teeth.<br />- Align strips with gum line and press gently for good contact.<br />- Fold the rest of strip behind teeth to keep in place.<br />3. Reveal:<br />- Wear strips for 30 minutes once a day, remove and discard.<br />- Crest Whitestrips Advanced Seal comes off cleanly.<br /><br />After using this kit for the full 14 days, here is what I have personally experienced:<br /><br />First of all, the claim by Crest that these strips hold much better to your teeth is true. In fact, when trying to remove these strips some may feel that they hold TOO good. I have found that removing them can be a somewhat difficult and messy task. After being in your mouth for 30 minutes the strips are rather slimy and slippery, so I have learned to pull one end loose and then use a tissue to pull the strip off my teeth. You really have to tug pretty hard in order to get these strips off from your teeth! Second, the strips still leave some unpleasant residue on your teeth, so you will want to make sure to brush right after removing the strips. Third, the strips are still a little bit of a pain to apply. It's hard to fold them over your teeth without getting creases in them. But, the fact that they hold strong is a great thing. They hold on tight for the full 30 minutes, and therefore don't slide around on your teeth like the previous Whitestrips did. I don't experience the excessive amount of saliva generated by the previous Whitestrips products either. Although some folks do experience a mild amount of increased sensitivity after repeated use of this product, I was able to complete the full 14 treatments (without skipping a day) without any discomfort whatsoever. These Advanced Seal Whitestrips are a great improvement in design, and they are ultimately much easier to use. I definitely notice that my teeth appear whiter within 2 to 3 treatments, and by the end of the 14-day treatment my teeth looked wonderfully bright.<br /><br />Overall I am very pleased with the improved design and excellent results provided by the Crest Advanced Seal Whitestrips product. They're not completely perfect, and they are still a bit of a chore to apply, use, and remove. But when all is said and done these strips are definitely the best effort produced by Crest yet. If you are looking for whiter, brighter teeth, and don't mind a 30 (35 minutes including removal and brushing afterward) minute inconvenience for 14 days, I highly recommend the Advanced Seal Whitestrips system from Crest. Shop around though, because they can be found much cheaper on the Internet than in local retail stores. I have found them nearly twenty dollars cheaper on sites like Amazon than what they sell for in brick and mortar stores. In these tough economic times it is always good to save a few bucks whenever possible. After all, paying more for the same product is not going to get your teeth any whiter. =o), and they are ultimately much easier to use. I definitely notice that my teeth appear whiter within 2 to 3 treatments, and by the end of the 14-day treatment my teeth looked wonderfully bright.<br /><br />Overall I am very pleased with the improved design and excellent results provided by the Crest Advanced Seal Whitestrips product. They're not completely perfect, and they are still a bit of a chore to apply, use, and remove. But when all is said and done these strips are definitely the best effort produced by Crest yet. If you are looking for whiter, brighter teeth, and don't mind a 30 (35 minutes including removal and brushing afterward) minute inconvenience for 14 days, I highly recommend the Advanced Seal Whitestrips system from Crest. Shop around though, because they can be found much cheaper on the Internet than in local retail stores. I have found them nearly twenty dollars cheaper on sites like Amazon than what they sell for in brick and mortar stores. In these tough economic times it is always good to save a few bucks whenever possible. After all, paying more for the same product is not going to get your teeth any whiter. =o)

  220. These strips do indeed work as claimed to noticeably bleach out stains from teeth. The taste is not unpleasant and having the strips plastered on the teeth for thirty minutes is tolerable. Sometimes they didn't stay in place the full half hour and slid around. My tongue was not very happy about them being there and couldn't sit still.<br /><br />I am a coffee and tea drinker and they certainly did make my teeth look cleaner and lighter, although my teeth are not very white naturally. This product is intended to restore your natural tooth color by removing stains and will not turn naturally ivory or yellow teeth a bright white.<br /><br />There was noticeably increased sensitivity especially at some exposed roots. If you have sensitive teeth or exposed roots you may want to talk to your dentist about teeth whitening options before using this product.<br /><br />The ideal user of this product is someone who has teeth that aren't sensitive but who has stains from drinking coffee or tea or from tobacco or other products like betel nut.<br /><br />Two cautions: you are NOT supposed to brush your teeth before using the strips and you should wash your hands well after handling them. Read the instructions and precautions carefully!<br /><br />Ingredients (with likely reason for inclusion in product)<br /><br />Water (solvent, allows dilution)<br />Glycerin (humectant--provides moisture, affects viscosity)<br />Hydrogen Peroxide (whitener)<br />Carbomer (controls consistency of solution)<br />Sodium Hydroxide (lye, used to control pH)<br />Sodium Saccharin (artificial sweetener)<br /><br />PVP and PEG-8 are listed as ingredients on some pages here on Amazon but not on the actual box of strips:<br /><br />PVP (emulsifier--keeps particles in solution)<br />PEG-8 (humectant, solvent)<br /><br />I received a free box of 10 pouches through Amazon Vine to review.
  221. The crest 3D white strips impressed me a lot. I was quite skeptical until I tried them and I am so glad I did! Within the first 3 days I noticed a change but not as much as by the 5th day. Instead of using them for only a half hour each day I wore them an hour. According to my dentist the ingredients on the strips are good for an hour to an hour and a half...not just a half hour:) I love these and am very glad I got them.
  222. This was a great deal and works really well. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who want's a great deal at a great price!
  223. I bought these to whiten my teeth before my wedding, and I'll admit I was a little bit skeptical. Though it takes 30 mins a day, that is a small amount of time to put aside to have a beautiful smile. I will continue using these strips to keep my smile looking the best it can possibly look!

The biggest con for me was when the whitening seemed to reach its limit, but I still had several days to go, and not much was happening. That said, I'm very happy with my inexpensive, 14-day whitening treatment, and I'm attempting to maintain it somewhat by using the Crest toothpaste that complements these whitestrips.

  246. The new Crest Advanced seal does what it says on the box. It adheres better than the regular whitestrips. If you have had trouble in the past with the regular whitestrips, make sure you dry the surface your teeth with a tissue or towel before trying to adhere. If you had no problem in the past with the regulars, these may get a little stuck on your teeth.<br /><br />Chemically these are the same as other tooth whitening systems and if you are sensitive to Rembrant, GoSmile and others you will be sensitive to this product. I would reccomend trying Supersmile toothpaste (skip the accelerator/activator tube) instead.<br /><br />What this product does:<br />* Convenient alternative to other products which require bathroom-sink time of 20mins+<br />* Quick & affordable alternative to mail-in custom mold type systems.<br />* Discreet enough to be brought onto vacations and other trips<br />* Maintenance/upkeep of whiter teeth between dentist visits.<br /><br />What this product does *not* do:<br />* Substitute for professional whitening at your dentist's office<br />* Will not effectively erase coffee/tea/wine/berry stains (other systems are better). Ineffective on nicotine stains.<br />* If you do not have straight incisors then this product will not adhere as well to your teeth or work as well.<br />* Depending on the size of your mouth & teeth, these strips may be either too long or too short. Obviously if it's too long, then just cut it, but if too short then the front few will be whiter and the side tooth or two will look unslightly yellow compared to the front few....<br />* This product *cannot* make your teeth whiter than they can naturally be.
  247. Wow what a difference. I have used teeth whiteners before being that I am an avid coffee and tea drinker. I have tried everything from teeth trays to brush-on whiting gel. I can honestly say this is the best whitestrips available today. As advertised, the advanced adhesive keeps the strips in place and you are even able to drink fluids while waiting the 30 minute processing time. I definitely notice a difference just after 3 days. I even had co-workers comment on how white my teeth looked. They were easy to apply but removing them takes a little effort since the adhesive holds them in place so well. You will have some residue after removing them but it can easily be removed if you rinse or brush your teeth afterward. This is a 14-day supply but you can cut the time in half and use the strips twice a day for faster results as directed. Keep in mind that these strips are not for everyone. My husband tried to use them but his teeth became extremely sensitive after just one use. I did not have any sensitivity issues.

  289. These work wonderfully for me. My teeth are pretty good to begin with, first off, but nothing special.   297. Before using this product I wanted my dentist's honest opinion of Crest Whitestrips. He said: \\"The products used by dentists to white teeth that actually do something are identical to the solution used in Crest Whitestips. What makes one work and another not work is how well the product keeps the solution in contact with the teeth. The original Crest Whitestrips did not work well because they did not stick to the teeth well enough. If the Advanced Seal actually stick to the teeth - buy the Crest Whitestrips and don't spend the extra money paying a dentist to overcharge you.\\"<br /><br />I asked about whether they work on bonded and capped teeth and he stated very simply that all whitening products work only on natural enamel. My bonded front teeth would not get any whiter excepted for the parts where the enamel is exposed and then I might wind up with ugly bi-colored front teeth.<br /><br />As for sensitivity - it is possible, with any whitener to experience temporary sensitivity. He recommended that if I experienced this problem to use the whitestrips once every three days and to use a good fluoride rinse on the two days in between. It will take longer to get results but you'll get the same results with less discomfort.<br /><br />How long does the effect last? He said the whitening is mostly permanent - that the teeth will darken a little over time but will never go back to their original shade. If you're dissatisfied with the darkening over time, repeat the process. It is not harmful to your teeth.<br /><br />My personal experience? The strips stick and stick pretty well. There are a couple of teeth that they start peeling off of before the 30 minutes is up but they're towards the back and don't show when I smile. My bonded front teeth are slightly lighter where the enamel is revealed but not enough to be obvious. The teeth that had no fillings, crowns or bonding are whitening. I've taken my dentists advice and am not using the strips every day. I skip a day or two between strips so I still have 4 days remaining. So far, I've not experienced any sensitivity.<br /><br />Based on my personal results and my dentist's recommendation, if you are considering whitening your smile, try the Advanced Seal Crest Whitestrips. Not only do they work well, but mine came with a NICE coupon for the next round and an even whiter smile.skip a day or two between strips so I still have 4 days remaining. So far, I've not experienced any sensitivity.<br /><br />Based on my personal results and my dentist's recommendation, if you are considering whitening your smile, try the Advanced Seal Crest Whitestrips. Not only do they work well, but mine came with a NICE coupon for the next round and an even whiter smile.
  298. I've always heard about these dental strips that supposedly make your teeth whiter so I thought I'd try one out. I got these Crest strips, which were the newest ones at the time, and have been using them for the past week. I can say with the utmost assurance that they do work; my teeth have gone from fairly clean to several shades whiter than before. Even my coworkers have noticed a difference.<br /><br />They're very simple to use. Just peel, apply, wait 30 minutes, and remove. See results in just a few days!<br /><br />However, as much as they work I have to stop using them. Something I noticed when I accidentally fell asleep with one of them on and it got stuck. After I ripped it off I had the worst day-and-a-half long tooth ache almost to the point of tears. I read the side of the box shortly thereafter to see a warning label saying, \\"May cause tooth sensitivity; this is temporary and not harmful.\\"<br /><br />It may not be harmful, but it was agonizing and it happened again the next two times I used it. This is probably my fauly, but I had to stop using them because the pain was effecting my work performance.<br /><br />Next time I get any sort of kewl new dental product, I'll be sure to read the warning and potential side effects label.
  299. At this point in the evolution of teeth whitening products, you would expect a few basic things.<br />1) They whiten your teeth<br />2) They are relatively simple to apply<br />3) They do not take a lot of time/effort to use<br />The Advanced Seal strips meet all these expectations. My teeth showed signs of whitening within 4 or 5 days. The two strips go on easily. They only require 30 minutes - ONCE a day and they stay on VERY well.<br /><br />So these stips pass all my tests.
