  300. Hi All,<br /><br />I received this product and ironically had a dentist's appointment for a cavity filling on the same day. After my filling I asked the dentist about this product and if she would let me know what shade I was currently showing...(YUCK might I add due to my coffee and smoking habits). She showed me a chart (which she gave me so I could keep it as a reference) which in good light allows you to see your current shade. Yellow! Yuck!<br /><br />Off I went to start using these strips rather then spend the hundreds of dollars required for a full on bleaching treatment at a dentist.<br /><br />So far I am about 8 days into the strips and I am noticing a little shy of ONE shade lighter. They are working. I doubt that in the next 6 days there will be a miracle...but I think I will be over one shade lighter.... Ironically again, my cleaning appointment is set around the same time so I will get a professional opinion and post my results.<br /><br />Here are some thoughts/tips on the strips themselves:<br /><br />The strips are packaged in individual little packets which makes it easy to take one with you when you cant spend the time to use it at home...for example if you travel for work like I do.<br /><br />When you open the packet, there are two strips on a little piece of plastic. You peel the strips of and stick them in place on your teeth.<br />Be careful so you can get as close to your gums as possible without sticking them on your gums. Sounds like a project, but it truly is easy.<br /><br />Press the strip onto your teeth, so the sticky part is touching the teeth. They start to work and must be left on for a total of 30 minutes.<br />When the 30 minutes is up, you peel it off and voila..day one is over...<br />I would recommend a quick brushing after you take them off to clean up your teeth and get rid of any residue...of which there is very little.<br /><br />The best part is that once you put the strip on it does not get in your way....you can drink water, talk properly (without sounding slurred), and go about your routine. 30 minutes is a very short time as it is...so you can always put it on during the day when you have some slow time at work or after dinner when you are watching TV, etc... There is a slight tingle that you will feel around the gums....that simply means they are working. My teeth are NOT overly sensitive so my results may be different that yours....its one of those things. I have had bleach treatments before which felt like there was a fire in my mouth...these are not as intensive...but as with anything that you use internally...speak to your medical professional before you use them.<br /><br />Remember, this is not a miracle cure for stained teeth...you have to take care of them and brush 2-3 times daily and floss like the dentist's recommend. (yeah I wrote that part because I know she is watching and going to come after me :-)) But seriously....these will help you remove some stains and make your teeth look better. But you must do your part to keep the stains off.<br /><br />As I stated above, I have an appointment for cleaning in about 7 days and will post a professionals opinion of the whitening strips after I get the results. What I see and what the dentist see's may not be eye to eye....no pun intended.<br /><br />More later......<br /><br />Hope that helps somewhat. Please comment with questions....I will be glad to answer what I can.n drink water, talk properly (without sounding slurred), and go about your routine. 30 minutes is a very short time as it is...so you can always put it on during the day when you have some slow time at work or after dinner when you are watching TV, etc... There is a slight tingle that you will feel around the gums....that simply means they are working. My teeth are NOT overly sensitive so my results may be different that yours....its one of those things. I have had bleach treatments before which felt like there was a fire in my mouth...these are not as intensive...but as with anything that you use internally...speak to your medical professional before you use them.<br /><br />Remember, this is not a miracle cure for stained teeth...you have to take care of them and brush 2-3 times daily and floss like the dentist's recommend. (yeah I wrote that part because I know she is watching and going to come after me :-)) But seriously....these will help you remove some stains and make your teeth look better. But you must do your part to keep the stains off.<br /><br />As I stated above, I have an appointment for cleaning in about 7 days and will post a professionals opinion of the whitening strips after I get the results. What I see and what the dentist see's may not be eye to eye....no pun intended.<br /><br />More later......<br /><br />Hope that helps somewhat. Please comment with questions....I will be glad to answer what I can.
  301. This being my first experience with a teeth whitening kit, I went into it with a completely open mind and hope for success. After about five days I did start to notice positive results, but by around day six I started experiencing a burning on my gums that was extremely uncomfortable. On top of that, my teeth started getting a lot more sensitive than I had expected. When wearing the strips, they put a funky taste in your mouth that lingers a while afterward, as well as a gooey film that took a while to subside. Because of that, I doubt I would try this product again.<br />Overall, if you're looking to save money over a professional whitening job, Crest Whitestrips Advanced Seal may be the way to go. Just be prepared to deal with the good and the bad, and you'll be fine.
  302. As a dentist, I am often asked by patients and friends where to start in terms of selecting a bleaching product. Since Crest produces some very good products, I generally steer them to Crest products. However, there are a multitude of Crest bleaching products to select from, so where does one begin? Here is my advice in selecting and using Crest Bleaching products:<br /><br />First, let's begin with the Crest Whitestrips Advanced Seal. This product was introduced in February, 2009. It contains a 10% hydrogen peroxide gel that is attached to a clear strip (like a band-aid) that wraps around the teeth. The primary advantage to this system is that the strip adheres to the teeth better than all the previous whitestrip products. In fact, some users report that it can be somewhat difficult to remove. However, having a strip that adheres to the teeth allows the user to do other things (remain active) while they bleach - work-out, shop, drive, talk, even drink fluids. The previous versions instructed the user to bleach for 30 minutes while stationary so the strip would not be displaced. In terms of bleaching effectiveness, Advanced Seal is equivalent to Crest Premium, Premium-Plus, and Pro Effects (as they all have a 10% hydrogen peroxide gel).<br /><br />A brief review of the other Crest bleaching products is in order to understand the options available. Crest White Strips come in as many as 7 different formulations. This can be very confusing for the consumer! Please remember the key difference in all these products is the strength of the hydrogen peroxide gel, and of course the price. The higher the dose of hydrogen peroxide, the faster the bleaching result, and the most costly as well. Here is a quick summary of the products:<br /><br />1. Crest White Strips Classic (6% hydrogen peroxide, 14-day treatment). 2. Crest White Strips Premium (10% hydrogen peroxide, 7-day treatment). 3. Crest White Strips Premium Plus (10% hydrogen peroxide, and has 12 additional strips).<br />4. Crest Pro Effects (10% hydrogen peroxide, 10-day treatment).<br />5. Crest Advanced Seal (10% hydrogen peroxide, 10-day treatment).<br />6. Daily Whitening Multicare (6% hydrogen peroxide, 5-minutes/day, 6-week supply)<br />7. Daily Whitening with Tartar Protection (6% hydrogen peroxide, 5-minutes/day, has a chemical that discourages tartar from attaching to the teeth, 38 upper and lower strips)<br /><br />In using any of the Crest bleaching products, please follow the specified instructions that come with each product.<br /><br />1. For most products, the instructions will direct you to bleach twice a day for 30-minutes a time. The inner part of the strip has a chemical called hydrogen peroxide that causes the stains inside your teeth to be oxidized and turn white. Applying the strips has a small learning curve as you will probably bend or fold a couple of them before you get the technique down.<br /><br />2. Leave the strips on for the time recommended in the instructions and do not overbleach your teeth, as this can lead to sensitivity. Crest bleaching products will generally work for most people, especially younger people and those with yellow stains.<br /><br />Potential Disadvantages to Consider<br /><br />1. Hydrogen Peroxide can \\"burn\\" your gums. If you notice a burning sensation when you use the product, it is the chemical oxidizing (or burning) your gums (it will turn them white with a minor chemical burn). Depending on how severe the burning is, it may cause you to want to stop the treatment. It is OK to stop the treatment for a day or two to let the gums heal. Once they are healed, resume treatment with the White Strips. Try to not get the strip too far up on your gums.<br /><br />2. Your teeth may become senstiive during the treatment time. Try to tolerate the sensitivity if it is mild, but if more severe, take a day or two off to let the teeth settle down and then pick up where you left off. You may notice much more sensitivity to cold water, ice cream, etc. The peroxide causes a revesible inflamation of the inner pulp, or nerve center of the tooth and makes the teeth very sensitive to biting or cold drinks or foods. If your teeth become too sensitive, back off on the strips until the sensitivity is gone before resuming bleaching.<br /><br />3. The strips only cover your front teeth, so only your front teeth will bleach. You may notice the distinct difference between the back (unbleached) teeth and the front (bleached) teeth. Since most people notice the front 6 teeth anyway, this is not a big deal. However, if you have a wide toothy smile, you may want to have a dentist make you a tray that will hold the chemical on the back teeth to whiten them too.<br /><br />4. The bleaching effect works best on yellow stains. If your stains are due to tetracycline (brownish grey stains in a band on your teeth, your best bet is to have a dentist whiten your teeth in the office for two sessions and then use White Strips to continue the bleaching process.<br /><br />Crest White Strips work for the vast majority of people. Younger people with yellow stains seem to respond better than older people or those with gray stains. If you have severely stained teeth, especially those with tetracycline (an antibiotic) stain, the strips may not work well for you.<br /><br />If you are not satisfied with the results and still want whiter teeth, you can then see your dentist for a more concentrated in-office form of bleaching. Crest offers a product called \\"Crest Whitestrips Supreme\\" through dental offices that can be used at home. It is a 14% hydrogen peroxide gel in a thinner strip. It is used for 30 minutes once or twice a day for 3 weeks.<br /><br />Jim \\"Konedog\\" Koenig, DDSold water, ice cream, etc. The peroxide causes a revesible inflamation of the inner pulp, or nerve center of the tooth and makes the teeth very sensitive to biting or cold drinks or foods. If your teeth become too sensitive, back off on the strips until the sensitivity is gone before resuming bleaching.<br /><br />3. The strips only cover your front teeth, so only your front teeth will bleach. You may notice the distinct difference between the back (unbleached) teeth and the front (bleached) teeth. Since most people notice the front 6 teeth anyway, this is not a big deal. However, if you have a wide toothy smile, you may want to have a dentist make you a tray that will hold the chemical on the back teeth to whiten them too.<br /><br />4. The bleaching effect works best on yellow stains. If your stains are due to tetracycline (brownish grey stains in a band on your teeth, your best bet is to have a dentist whiten your teeth in the office for two sessions and then use White Strips to continue the bleaching process.<br /><br />Crest White Strips work for the vast majority of people. Younger people with yellow stains seem to respond better than older people or those with gray stains. If you have severely stained teeth, especially those with tetracycline (an antibiotic) stain, the strips may not work well for you.<br /><br />If you are not satisfied with the results and still want whiter teeth, you can then see your dentist for a more concentrated in-office form of bleaching. Crest offers a product called \\"Crest Whitestrips Supreme\\" through dental offices that can be used at home. It is a 14% hydrogen peroxide gel in a thinner strip. It is used for 30 minutes once or twice a day for 3 weeks.<br /><br />Jim \\"Konedog\\" Koenig, DDS

  316. I have incredibly sensitive teeth- to the point where I have NEVER been able to whiten them. This is my fourth attempt with a tooth whitening product (strips!). Last year I made it to day 2 before calling it quits- as I would get sharp, shooting pains in my teeth after one use, and I wouldn't be able to sleep. My mother in law loves me- I've been funding her white teeth (minus a strip or 2).<br /><br />However I've been able to do a weeks worth of these already, and I'm fine! Here's what I noticed. The first day, I left it on for 35 minutes. Big mistake. Felt fine, until about 4 hours later when my mouth started throbbing. Pain! It felt like someone was randomly crunching my tooth with a pair of pliers, and alternately hammering an ice pick into the root.Try sleeping with that! Orajel didn't help, glopping on sensodyne didn't either. I swalloed a couple advil and prayed for sleep.<br /><br />The next day, I was fine- pain was gone, but I was once bitten twice shy. No way Jose, white teeth are NOT worth that! I grabbed my sensodyne and pushed the box of strips back into the corner. That night I religiously used my sensodyne and cast a hateful glare at the crest box.<br /><br />But by next morning, fully rested, the full box of strips beckoned to me, and I thought, how bad can it be? I'll try one more, and do it for less time. So Day 3 I did strip 2- and I timed it to 28 minutes, to allow for the 2 minutes it took to get on and take off. Surprise!! No pain! Hurray! My teeth look a tiny tiny bit whiter, but not enough to really notice..I was dying to do strip 3, where everyone says they get their results...<br /><br />So on Day 4, I did a 3rd one. Timed it again, but noticed some sensitivity. Not nearly as bad as day one,more like a hint of what could come- I figured the pain would accumulate with multiple strips and took another day off.<br /><br />And guess what? It worked. No pain!! Yes it will take me almost a month to do (I'm only half way after 2 weeks, but no pain other than day 1), but if you have a lot of sensitivity, it works! Do it every other day, or just take days off when needed. And TIME it!! That extra 5 minutes makes a HUGE difference! I also bought sensitive toothpaste and started using it, which may be helping as well. OH! And do NOT bruish your teeth before doing the strips...do them after dinner, and brush the excess gunk off instead.<br /><br />So far I have VERY noticeable results, and very minimal discomfort. Very pleased so far, especially since I've never been able to whiten before! I've done a lot of research and the pain is temporary, there are no lasting effects. So I plan to continue to through the second half as quickly as I can tolerate, and will definitely buy again.pain other than day 1), but if you have a lot of sensitivity, it works! Do it every other day, or just take days off when needed. And TIME it!! That extra 5 minutes makes a HUGE difference! I also bought sensitive toothpaste and started using it, which may be helping as well. OH! And do NOT bruish your teeth before doing the strips...do them after dinner, and brush the excess gunk off instead.<br /><br />So far I have VERY noticeable results, and very minimal discomfort. Very pleased so far, especially since I've never been able to whiten before! I've done a lot of research and the pain is temporary, there are no lasting effects. So I plan to continue to through the second half as quickly as I can tolerate, and will definitely buy again.

  332. I've only used the Crest 3D Advanced Vivid Whitestrips for 4 days, and have already seen a difference in my teeth. I'm over 60 and have never used a dental whitener before. I drink coffee and tea everyday. I was reluctant to have my dentist do it because of the cost. I have followed the directions exactly, except for only very lightly brushing off (not scrubbing) my teeth if I feel they aren't clean enough. I have a lot of saliva in my mouth, so I breathe through my teeth for a few seconds to dry them off before applying the strips. They stick very well this way. I haven't had any tooth or gum sensitivity, but my lips were a little irritated, so I've been putting on chapstick after the strips are in. No problem.<br /><br />Prior to using the strips my top and bottom teeth were noticeably more yellow than the teeth near them with crowns. After 4 uses the teeth are much closer in tone. I will continue with the strips until they are gone (there are enough for 14 applications) or until I'm happy with the level of whiteness. I think that $31 is a very reasonable price for this product, especially if they are effective.

  336. I have tried other Crest whitestrips that would slip around on my teeth and made me feel like I wanted to swallow all the time (of course, trying not to only makes it worse; lol). The first three times I used these I wanted to swallow (and let me tell you, they taste like hydrogen peroxide; not the most pleasant taste), but now I can put them on without having the urge to constantly swallow and spit like I did with the older versions.   337. While these did stay on my teeth well, they were extremely painful. Crest Whitestrips Advanced Seal addresses the first issue (they really do stay on quite well for the recommended duration of time), but they send shooting pains up my canines and make my top teeth ache the next day.<br /><br />The packaging is better designed than other brands I've tried (no trays, etc.). Each set of strips (top and bottom) come in their own small wrapper which is slightly difficult to open, but generally a clean and easy process.<br /><br />Positives: they stay on for the recommended amount of time so if it weren't for the shooting pains, I would probably forget they were on; no awkward mouth-foaming or other uncomfortable side effects I've experienced with other brands; relatively easy packaging.<br /><br />Negatives: extremely painful; strips didn't cover entire set of teeth (only about 6 on both top and bottom); expensive.<br /><br />I cannot comment on their effectiveness in whitening because they were too painful for me to leave on for the full amount of time. I bought these a week before going to the dentist to get two teeth caps. As you may or may not know, when you get caps/veneers, they match the color to the rest of your teeth. Caps and veneers don't change colors so you want your teeth to be as white as possible when you get it done so that your teeth will be white. In about 4 days time, these strips totally whitened my teeth. The dentist even told me he used the brightest cap because my teeth were so white. I definitely recommend these to anyone and I'll certainly be purchasing these again to keep my teeth this white. I honestly can't stop smiling. :)

  359. I have previously used the original version of Whitestrips, the ones you apply several times a day, so that is what I can compare these to. The big difference for me is that these only need to be applied once a day. These do hold to the teeth a lot better, the old ones would slide around, need adjusting etc. (the heartbreak of adjusting Whitestrips)! These definitely take fewer days to see results----I would get so frustrated with the first ones, that I gave up before I finished the box. I seem to forget these are on, probably because they just don't slide around and wad up behind my teeth. If your experience was anything like mine, I would think that if you tried these, you would probably change your mind about Whitestrips.
  360. Crest \\"White Strips Advanced Seal\\" come in boxes of 14 strips to be used over a period of 2 weeks.<br /><br />By no means is this some miracle product that will make your teeth pearly white, but the effects are noticeable. The change in whiteness was most noticeable during the first three days of use, but it seemed to slow down after that.<br /><br />The strips are pretty inexpensive and somewhat effective for the price. Applying the strips is quite simple as it just requires a simple folding of the strip around the front teeth. After using the product for the first time I found that there was a slight discomfort and increased sensitivity in my teeth where the whiting strip was placed. However, after continuing the usage of the whitening strips I found that the pain eventually disappeared (around the 7th day of using the product) and the sensitivity was also gone.<br /><br />I'd give the product a 3/5 for effectiveness, 2/5 for comfortableness and a 5/5 for ease of application with an overall score of 3/5.
  361. They are working out fairly well....however, I ordered 2 packets of &#34;Glamorous White&#34; and received instead 2 packets of<br />Advanced Vivid. Decided to avoid the hassle of returning and waiting again and put them to use.
  362. I love these little beauties! I keep them in my travel kits and cosmetics bags. I found this particular product to be much stronger than I needed, so I experienced tooth sensitivity after I used them. However, because they were so powerful, I was able to use them less frequently and for a shorter amount of time. I can pop these on before I shower and remove them once I'm done with my hair and makeup and my teeth will be noticeably whiter.<br /><br />Pros: Improved adhesive - these stay put.   378. More than once in the past, I've had to fidget with a whitening strip that folded over or wrinkled while I was trying to get it on my teeth, usually losing most of the gel in the process, sometimes rendering the strip unusable. On top of that, I always found that once I got the strip on, I really had to focus on keeping it in place, since the slightest mouth or tongue movement would cause it to slide off(and you KNOW how your tongue wants to explore that alien object in your mouth). I found this new formulation helpful with both of those drawbacks. The strip was easier to position to begin with and considerably easier to keep in place. I didn't experience any particular difficulty getting the strips off, either. Although the whitening is not as good as a dentist's treatment, they do an acceptable job for a comparatively bargain price. I'll buy these again next time it's time to spiff up my teeth.
  379. This is a wonderfully improved tooth whitening product; and it addresses many of the major flaws in the 1st generation products. I've previously used the Listerine Whitening strips, and although they were effective, were rather painful (from the peroxide) and hard to apply. These Advanced whitestrips solve many of those issues.<br /><br />PROS:<br />----------------------<br />- Very little to no pain; they seem to have adjusted and optimized the peroxide in the strips.<br /><br />- No foaming, so you don't look like a rabid dog. Again, probably from optimization of the peroxide. You leave them in your mouth for about 30 minutes, and you can go about your business.<br /><br />- Very easy to remove from the backing and apply- this is the largest improvement I'd say. The Listerine strips were hard to apply because they would stick to the slightest bit of moisture (e.g. your fingers) and get jumbled up.<br /><br />- Neutral taste- does not leave an aftertaste or for that matter, other tastes during application.<br /><br />- Works effectively- the box says you'll see results in as little as 3 days. That's no joke! My teeth were much whiter after just 3 days, and I will gladly continue to use them.<br /><br />CONS:<br />-------------------<br /><br />- After treatment is done, the strips are a bit hard to remove from your teeth, leaving a sticky residue that I had to brush off. It's a minor quibble, since the strips solve all the major issues that plague its competitors. Furthermore, they tell you to use these prior to brushing your teeth, so subsequent brushing will remove any residual material.<br /><br />I would give it 4.5 stars, but Amazon doesn't allow half stars, so 4 it is.
  380. I got these strips for my 17 year old daughter who wants perfectly white teeth after 2+ years with braces. She likes them very much. They stay on well and don't slide around or taste \\"funky\\" like other brands. These actually worked very quickly. After 5 days I noticed her smiling wider and happier. Her teeth actually look whiter and I didn't think they needed whitening at all so for me to notice they really worked! I tried one just to test flavor, texture, stickiness and durability. I liked the flavor, didn't notice them on my teeth to much and I had no problem removing it from my teeth. Overall I will continue to buy this brand of whitening seals over others on the market.   381. Got two weeks until the big event? This is the product that *might* be for you. I am an avid coffee drinker (as in a 4-6 cup/day habit), so I have room for improvement in the white teeth department.<br /><br />Overview: two very clear strips that are harder than a contact lens to find when you put the film with the strips on it down on the sink. Wear once to twice per day (I went with once) for 2 weeks for 30 minutes at a time. The fine print says you are not supposed to use them right after brushing, and they won't work with caps or artificial teeth.<br /><br />Pros:<br />1) Strips stuck and molded fairly well to my teeth<br />2) I could and did shower with them regularly with no problems<br />3) I looked like a rabid dog while wearing them, which I showed off obsessively to my children's delights and my husband's dismay (but I found it extremely funny)<br />4) They really did whiten, although without an included whitening guide, it is difficult to tell how much (I sort of made my own, and they did apparently whiten really well despite uneven whitening)<br />5) It came with a seven dollar coupon<br />6) I did not find the hydrogen peroxide to leak much, so there was no nasty taste unless I went probing with my tongue<br /><br />Cons:<br />1) My teeth or smile must be big, because they did not fully cover the fronts of my teeth (the upper strip made it to a half of each canine, which show when I smile) - it was an obvious color difference after a week, so that's a pretty big negative!<br />2) Whitening was uneven - especially where teeth are close together - this would be unacceptable if you are getting close-up pics (e.g. for a bride or new \\"significant\\" other) but okay at a distance<br />3) I talked with a noticeable lisp while wearing them - and I forgot and answered the door once with them in full foaming mode<br />4) I don't have super sensitive teeth - but man did these things change that - ouch! It caused me to cut back on my coffee, so maybe a good thing?<br /><br />Overall, my dentist will do a basic whitening for just over one hundred dollars and a deep cleaning 2x per year is covered in my dental plan. This would be a better choice in my humble opinion for brides-to-be. If you have a wide smile and bigger than average teeth (you know who you are), this may not be the best choice b/c trust me - your canines will look even MORE yellow when the adjacent teeth are pearly.<br /><br />The bottom line: I would not purchase these as is since they were not wide enough to sufficiently cover and whiten my top teeth, which makes me feel like a freak. Thanks, Crest! Using 1.5 strips for the top would be an acceptable work-around for me. Based on the convenience and ease of use, I do think they are likely worth the price for most people needing light whitening./><br />Overall, my dentist will do a basic whitening for just over one hundred dollars and a deep cleaning 2x per year is covered in my dental plan. This would be a better choice in my humble opinion for brides-to-be. If you have a wide smile and bigger than average teeth (you know who you are), this may not be the best choice b/c trust me - your canines will look even MORE yellow when the adjacent teeth are pearly.<br /><br />The bottom line: I would not purchase these as is since they were not wide enough to sufficiently cover and whiten my top teeth, which makes me feel like a freak. Thanks, Crest! Using 1.5 strips for the top would be an acceptable work-around for me. Based on the convenience and ease of use, I do think they are likely worth the price for most people needing light whitening.
  382. This product is a fourteen-day whitening treatment, applied once a day with form-fitting strips that are removed 30 minutes after application.<br /><br />I agree with the manufacturer's statement that it takes 3-4 days to notice a difference. At first I thought I was seeing a difference right away, but really the strips just leave temporary white dots on your teeth that, when viewed from a distance, leave you with the impression that this is the final result for that particular application, but again, those dots are temporary. Gradually, a difference is certainly visible, and by the end of the treatment, the result is very satisfactory in my opinion. But then, I don't smoke. I do drink coffee.<br /><br />Application is simple, and yes, this product leaves your teeth gummy after the strips are removed. But this is a minor problem that is resolved with brushing, but if you don't brush right away it comes off on its own within a couple of minutes. No big deal.<br /><br />Application is easy and covers the visible teeth. While the coverage is not the same as if you used a treatment involving a tray, the good part is you can compare your back teeth to your front ones and see the extent of the change. Some people may find the coverage of the bottom teeth inadequate.<br /><br />In my experience this treatment does not leave my teeth a super-ultra slap-you-in-the-face white, but it does leave my teeth a pretty white that is still natural-looking. I like that, and for the money, I think it's a fine product.<br /><br />At the time this is written, the box includes a generous coupon as well.<br /><br />Personally I had no issues with sensitivity. I did notice a slight tingling on my tongue and in my throat the first few times I used this, but nothing regarding sensitivity in my teeth or gums.
  383. I could tell the difference in color in my teeth within just a couple of days! Much whiter! The strips are really easy to use and adhere quite well to my teeth. I am hoping one day there will be a tooth whitener that doesn't cause such sensitivity.

This is also the reason your teeth get so sensitive and translucent (bluest-destroyed enamel) when using these products. I used baking soda with tooth paste now works great.

  428. I had previously tried Crest's original Whitestrips and although I was happy with the results, I wasn't crazy about the strips themselves. They were tricky to position and, honestly, not the most comfortable things in the world. I subsequently tried some brush-on versions, and while they were less invasive, they also didn't whiten as satisfactorily. But Whitestrips Advanced Seal finally gives you the best of both worlds--noticeable whitening in just a few days (you only need to apply one a day for two weeks) plus a more secure fit. I'll never be 100% comfortable with what feels like plastic wrap adhered to my teeth, but for the 30-minute investment the results are undeniable. I had no issue with gum sensitivity although the strips occasionally seal too well and sometime require a little coaxing from the back of the teeth to release--a relatively small price to pay for a whiter smile!
  429. The box comes with 14 packets - each of which contains two strips. You put one on the upper teeth and the other on the lower. It is only necessary to leave them on for 30 minutes. I was impressed by how easy it was to do. The adhesive held the strips in place, but they came off fairly easily. On the occasion that a bit of adhesive did stick, I used the brush on my waterpik to take it off.<br /><br />After 4 days, I did need to take a break as my gums are becoming very sensitive. I drink a lot of tea and my teeth are a shade or two whiter already. Maybe tea stains come off easily.<br /><br />These are the first strips I've used, but I've heard other people complain of things like foaming and after taste. These had almost no flavor at all and didn't foam. They were very easy to use and I had no real issues.<br /><br />Overall, these worked well. Only having to use them once a day and seeing results so soon was nice. Next time I do this though, I won't do it until my gums become sensitive.
  430. Already a fan of Crest Whitestrips, I wasn't expecting that there was anything that Crest could do to improve its product. I was wrong.<br /><br />Crest Whitestrips Advanced Seal work essentially the same as the original Whitestrips, but fit much better! They stuck easily to my teeth, and actually stayed on - no more slipping around and readjusting the strips! The best thing is that because the strips stick so well, I was able to talk and be understood clearly. While it is possible to take a drink of water while wearing these strips, I didn't feel particularly comfortable while doing so - besides, these strips only need to stay on for 30 minutes each application.<br /><br />The strips are easy to remove and left very little residue on my teeth afterwards. I did not have any problems with tooth sensitivity, and was pleased with the results - whiter teeth! Highly recommended!

  433. I do not smoke, but I like strong coffee. I may not have very strong enamel as I do have some cavities from when I was young so I may be kind of susceptible to having a less than winning smile. My teeth have been kind of dingy-looking and I have really wanted to have a brighter smile as I am in a performing group want to look my best.<br /><br />I decided I would try these strips because I have used trays and gel previously and these strips work much better. They stick VERY well to my teeth and what little talking I may need to do while on my homeward commute was not very affected by them. I think they whiten my teeth very well (in fact, better than anything else I have tried) and they do not make my teeth or gums sore. They stick so well that it is a little bit of a struggle to remove them. The taste was not objectionable to me. I did begin to see results in three days. I did try making sure my teeth were clean and moist and they did not stick as well. If you have a wider smile or bigger teeth, you might want to try alternating having the product more on one side than the one on one day and then reverse on alternate days.<br /><br />I think this product works as advertised and even made my teeth feel cleaner and smoother!
  434. Excellent and easy to use! My teeth are whiter and brighter and I love how easy it is to use. You definitely can't go wrong with this one!
  435. I have never used a teeth whitening product before trying these Crest Whitestrips, Advanced Seal. Thus, I have nothing to compare them to except my original teeth coloring. The strips were extremely easy to use. You just peel them from the backing and stick them directly on your bottom and then top teeth. They remain there for 30 minutes. You are able to drink water while the strips are doing their job.<br />While they are in your mouth, you do feel a gummy texture. I have sensitive taste buds, and I did not enjoy the taste of the strips. They made me feel like my breath stunk. It was definitely endurable. I also got acclimated to them with each continued use.<br /><br />Now, the most important question... Do they work? I would say yes. It's hard to tell on your own teeth. Others have noticed and commented on them. They are a natural white, my teeth don't look bleached out or fake.<br /><br />The one problem I have had a certain times while using the product is teeth sensitivity. With use of the product, my teeth have been very sensitive to cold and wind. The box states that it is normal, and it will go away. I do agree with that; the feeling is short-lived.
  436. These strips are 100% worth the cost. We follow strict dental hygiene, yet these strips are still necessary for teeth once in a while. I am celebrating a big event month week, and I plan to apply these strips once again before the big day!<br />Just perks to this product: easy to use, satisfactory results a given, and safe! At this point it will be very sticky and you may want to wash your hands afterwards just to get the chemicals off. It should return to normal within 24-48 hours after application. If not then you do have a problem. Every now and again you may wish to stop treatment for a day or two. I did this two or three times just to give it a rest, or because I forgot. Not really an issue.

  479. I've always struggled with yellow teeth due to genetics/too much coffee & red wine, but my teeth are so sensitive that I've never really been able to effectively make it through a cycle of whitening strips. In the past, I've used them and had to stop due to sensitivity and pain. These, however, seem to be MUCH better than some of the previous Crest versions I've tried (it's been about a year/year and a half since I last tried), and I also utilize the following methods for cutting down on sensitivity that I thought I'd share:<br /><br />1. Don't wrap the full strip around your teeth, top and bottom -- just stick them on the front of your teeth without wrapping around the back. Though they're not the most comfortable in this position, I've found that it really cuts down on any post-whitening pain (and who cares if the backs of your teeth are white?).<br />2. Try alternating days instead of attempting to whiten 14 straight days in a row. Obviously this takes twice as long, but it's worth it if you really struggle with sensitivity.<br />3. Only use the strips for 20-25 minutes instead of the full 30.<br /><br />These are just the measures that I take; but I have noticed pretty dramatic whitening and I'm not even all the way through the cycle yet. I'm actually happy with my smile for the first time in years!

  504. I expected to have to use these for at least 3 days to a week in order to notice any results. I have never used any sort of strips before, and tried Luster One Hour Tooth Whitening with the fancy light contraption, which I promptly returned after realizing what a useless product it was.<br /><br />I tried these strips today. I used \\"as directed\\" and stayed in the bathroom getting myself ready, so was able to spit out any of the foamy peroxide that I didn't want to swallow (though I haven't read anything in the instructions that cautioned against swallowing it--I did swallow some, inevitably).<br /><br />After peeling off the extremely sticky strips (also not what I expected--I thought they would sort of fall away after some minutes. I had no problems peeling them away, by the way), I was very surprised and delighted to notice a difference after the first application. Maybe that is due to staining that came off easily with the peroxide chemical, but it was still quite nice to see my teeth whiter than they have been in a very long time.<br /><br />The size of the strips were fine--they fit the height of my upper and lowers, with enough room to fold a little around the edges of the teeth. I have read some reviews about them being too short and not whitening the back teeth, but an easy solution would be to use two strips for uppers and two for lowers, starting at the molars and going toward the front, letting the strips overlap at the very front of your teeth. That way your backs and fronts will get the same treatment.<br /><br />So far, I have no sensitivity, but I do know that using a peroxide chemical in your mouth when you have metal fillings *can* very well give you sensitivity. The one time I ever used a whitener (a tray, once, a few years ago), I noticed right away that the area around the metal fillings was much more sensitive and stayed that way for a while after use.<br /><br />I will continue to use the strips until I see the desired whiteness... and I highly recommend them to others.recommend them to others.

  518. I recently bought these because I was annoyed with the discoloration that my teeth have taken over the years. I was considering a visit to the dentist to have my teeth whitened but did research on the cost and decided to try a different alternative in the form of the whitening strips. After looking at reviews and watching YT videos about the product I made my decision to invest in the product. There are 7 treatments for your upper teeth and 7 treatments for your lower teeth for a total of 14 treatments. The pros are that the whitening strips grip your teeth so you don't have to worry about them slipping off and you will see results right away. You may not need to do all of the treatments depending on how white you are trying to get your teeth. The cons are that there will be some sensitivity along your gum line after treatments and you are expected to wear the strips for 2 hours. My results were fantastic and are definitely a product that I will purchase in the future if I would like to whiten my teeth. The price paid was a fraction of what you would pay if you went to a dentists office to have a whitening procedure done.
  519. I try to use this once every few weeks, but I have to be very careful to remove it within the prescribed 30 minutes, or I will get a tooth sensitivity that makes eating/drinking kind of unpleasant for a day or two. It definitely does the trick, though. Just don't expect miracles.

  524. I will start by saying that although I was expecting some sensitivity issues (I read a lot of reviews...) there has been none until now. I did start brushing with Sensodyne Rapid about two weeks before starting the white strips, and I continue to brush with it right after I remove the strips. I have also been using Sensodyne Protect & Repair with Novamin. I just removed my 4th pair of strips and to be honest I don't see a difference... My teeth are still as yellow as before. I don't smoke or drink coffee/wine, so I guess it's just the quality of my enamel. I really was not expecting a drastic change, but after 4 treatments I thought there would be a little improvement.... I don't know, should I still be hopeful? Now, about the infamous bottom strip: dear sirs at Crest, the bottom strip in the Advanced Vivid is ridiculously small! I mean, seriously, who wants to have six beautiful whitened teeth sitting right next to two or three yellow ones?? It shows! No one has such a small mouth. I had to use one packet of strips just to cut into pieces so I could cover the other teeth, which in my case are the darker ones. So, I'm already down one treatment. Other than that, the advanced seal works very well, the strips are easy to apply and remove and leave no taste in my mouth. No sensitivity in the gums either. Now my question is what white strips version should I try in case these do not work at all, and how long should I wait inbetween treatments? I would really like to get rid of some of this yellowing... Can you help me Crest? I will come back and update this review towards the end of the treatment. Keeping my fingers crossed!<br /><br />Edit<br />Day 5: I left the strips on for one hour this time, although it is not recommended and Crest does say the product won't whiten past the recommended time. Sure enough I still can't see any real change in shade. The teeth look whiter right after I remove the strips, but after a few seconds the color is back to normal. I did experience a few twinges on my teeth about 8 to 10 hours after this treatment, nothing painful, just weird. I guess leaving the strips for longer than recommended does improve your chances of getting sensitivity. Still not impressed.<br /><br />Edit<br />Day 6: this time I went back to the recommended 30 minutes routine and the slight sensitivity didn't come back. I have finally started to notice a difference in teeth shade, they are not much whiter (maybe one shade whiter) but they are definitely brighter! Also I went to the dentist and had them professionally cleaned, I hope that helps a little with the process.<br /><br />Edit<br />Results! I can now say that my teeth are much whiter and I am so pleased! Still a few days to go so it can only get better. It took me about six days to really start seeing a difference but these actually really work, it's worth the wait. I'm rating these strips 4 stars just because of the size of the bottom strip. Other than that they work great and gave me no pain or discomfort.ence a few twinges on my teeth about 8 to 10 hours after this treatment, nothing painful, just weird. I guess leaving the strips for longer than recommended does improve your chances of getting sensitivity. Still not impressed.<br /><br />Edit<br />Day 6: this time I went back to the recommended 30 minutes routine and the slight sensitivity didn't come back. I have finally started to notice a difference in teeth shade, they are not much whiter (maybe one shade whiter) but they are definitely brighter! Also I went to the dentist and had them professionally cleaned, I hope that helps a little with the process.<br /><br />Edit<br />Results! I can now say that my teeth are much whiter and I am so pleased! Still a few days to go so it can only get better. It took me about six days to really start seeing a difference but these actually really work, it's worth the wait. I'm rating these strips 4 stars just because of the size of the bottom strip. Other than that they work great and gave me no pain or discomfort.

Also, these strips can be tough to get off, but this is a GOOD thing, as they won't be sliding around your mouth dissolving your gumline for the half hour.   559. Prior to purchasing Crest 3D Whitestrips, I had used the basic version of these. The simpler whitestrips were always effective -- with plenty of hydrogen peroxide (which actually whitens the teeth). A downside, which the 3D Whitestrips offer, is that the basic version's strips would slip. If I was wearing them, I'd need to keep my mouth very still to prevent any movement.<br /><br />The Crest 3D Whitestrips with Advanced Seal Technology offer a no-slip, hassle-free grip. Before I purchased these, I thought, &#34;Wonderful!&#34; And they are (sort of)! I can talk, move my mouth, and even drink water. I don't need to worry about them getting misaligned of overly burning my gums from the whitening material.<br /><br />Unfortunately, and this is what takes 2 stars away, they don't provide enough coverage. The strips are both shorter in length and have less whitening material. This leads to a small section of teeth getting whitened and in a slower manner. Frankly, I'm disappointed in this no-slip technology because it only tends to coat the front portions of teeth -- not between the cracks.<br /><br />Yes, they definitely will whiten your teeth, but I'll be looking to downgrade to the slip-prone versions from here on out.
  560. I'm sure there's some difference, but I didn't take any before and after pictures so I wouldn't be able to notice the gradual change. I got the 2 week pack and use them over 16 days. Forgot two times due to hurrying in the morning. I left them on for 1 hour instead of 30 mins just because it timed out better with my commute.<br /><br />These things are really easy to put on and they stick like Krazy Glue. Seriously, once they are on they don't move. I did not drink anything hot while I had them on, but I was able to drink water easily. The hardest part is trying to get them off, but with a little practice it becomes easy. Using a floss stick pick would help removal as well. After removal there is a tiny bit of a slimy feel on your teeth but it does not taste bad and you can rinse it out really fast or just let it dissolve which it does in a few seconds.<br /><br />Definitely noticed my teeth were whiter after the 2 weeks. How much, not sure, but there was a noticeable improvement. I will do it again in 6 months as I am now a true convert.

Although the lower strip could have been a little bigger, to cover more of my bottom teeth, I have no regrets purchasing this product.<br /><br />Now, I had read multiple reviews for this product before purchasing and saw that there was a consistency with tooth sensitivity from other users. I will say YES, it will make your teeth sensitive after use, but will occur a couple of hours after taking the strips off. Fortunately there is a solution, there are toothpaste products out there that are directly made for sensitive teeth, such as Sensodyne, where the sensitivity is eliminated! So I highly suggest that if you buy the whitening strips, you need to pick up of toothpaste for sensitive teeth and that problem will be solved.<br /><br />After 14 days my teeth a remarkably whiter and I am extremely satisfied with my smile now. The only thing I regret is that I did not take before and after pictures to show everyone the dramatic transformation.

Parts of my teeth were still yellow, even though I used the product according to instructions. Overall, my teeth was whiter from a distance.   659. This product is absolutely amazing. I am on my 3rd day of treatment and I have noticed dramatic effects (Night and Day). I was a huge skeptic before starting my treatment, i didn't know which brand to choose, and whether it would actually work. Let me put it this way, Crest is the way to go. There are 2-hour treatments, but those probably cause agonizing tooth pain. Granted, these strips cause pain, but that is complimentary with any tooth whitener. The results will vary by user, but coming from a guy who usually doesn't experience tooth sensitivity, this product causes a great amount of pain(As does any other product), but for a short time, and the more you use it, the more bearable it gets. NO FEAR, it does not cause any long-term tooth sensitivity, just for a couple hours after you use it. I like to put them an hour before bed time, although it makes it harder to fall asleep, by the time i wake up, it is long, long gone. Again, if your teeth are originally sensitive, be prepared! Other than the tooth sensitivity and very little gum discomfort (which are a testament to teeth whiteners in general, not this product specifically) this product is great, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to family and friends. I cant wait until the 14th day when my choppers are egg white and my confidence is boosted tenfold.<br />one more comment, i have 2 small brown stains on my two front teeth. Now I am not a coffee, or Soda drinker so i have no clue where these stains originated. They haven't really dissolved yet, but i am hoping at the end of the treatment, they will be gone. This shouldn't scare away people who have coffee stains, because i believe the product is tailored to coffee stains. My stains have some other biological reason behind them, and my Dentist should be able to fix the problem.<br /><br />General rule of thumb is:<br />If you have sensitive teeth stay away from the intense treatments (2-hour) The stronger the product, the more pain caused!!

  690. I've tried teeth whitening many times in the past, always through dentist. I used to have a better job than I do now, so, I honestly don't have the 400$ to pay a dentist every time I want my teeth a little brighter -- which is something that is kind of important to me. Hopefully this review will help people that know a lot about teeth whitening, but also those who know nothing. One major thing to know about teeth whitening all of them are enamel safe nowadays. That said, that doesn't mean it teeth whitening is always pain free. If you have sensitive teeth, it will be sensitive regardless of if you go to the dentist or use a retail solution like Crest. The sensitivity is completely temporary and will go away once you stop whitening. If this is something you are very worried about, I would recommend you whiten every other day instead of every day, and it will dramatically decrease sensitivity, so this is not something you should be concerned about.<br /><br />I used Crest because, well, everybody knows Crest and they should be a reliable company that has a reliable product. My dentist recommended that I try a strip-based whitener, [[ASIN:B001OOLLVS Crest 3D White Whitestrips with Advanced Seal Technology, 14 Treatments]], and a tray based whitener, [[ASIN:B00LNIW1EQ Brilliant HD - Deluxe Teeth Whitening Kit]], so I can see which type of system works better for me. My dentist explained to me some of the positives/negatives of both types of whitening systems, and also explained how the tray system is actually closer to what I originally used years ago when I paid 400$ through my dentist. Even though the crest whitestrips were easy to use, I felt that they really didn't have the same level of quality and effect that I got form the tray style system. With trays, you get something that is custom fit to your mouth, which is a little better for whitening then a one-size-fits-all strip system. One interesting note, I found that my teeth were just as sensitive (not really too sensitive at all just a little) whether I used the tray style or the strip style. So it was just a matter of what system whitened more, and in this case it was the tray-style.<br /><br />In the end I'll go for the tray type of whitening kit because its more similar to what dentists use and I had more luck with the speed in which my teeth whitened. I have heard some people with problems using the tray type because if you overload the tray with too much gel you can get it on your gums and it may temporarily hurt.<br /><br />If you don't think you can load the trays properly, then maybe the strip kind is for you. They come prepackaged so in that sense it might be easier. For the strips, you should really try hard to use your finger-nails or some type of depression tool (a toothpick would work) to get the whitening gel into the indents of your teeth. I used the strips for a few times and noticed that it wasn't whitening all of my teeth, just the surface that touches the strips. Also if you decide to use the strips you have to really worry about getting the solution on your gums. This can be just as painful as having sensitive teeth. If you can get over these two obstacles, than the strip style solution is not bad. I just like the tray-style because it avoids these two problems.<br /><br />If you want better/faster results and feel like you can follow a simple video guide or a few written instructions, then I would suggest getting a teeth whitening kit that uses trays. If you have perfectly straight teeth and your gums are not sensitive, then the strips might work out just fine. Like my dentist said, try both and see which option works best for you.sensitive at all just a little) whether I used the tray style or the strip style. So it was just a matter of what system whitened more, and in this case it was the tray-style.<br /><br />In the end I'll go for the tray type of whitening kit because its more similar to what dentists use and I had more luck with the speed in which my teeth whitened. I have heard some people with problems using the tray type because if you overload the tray with too much gel you can get it on your gums and it may temporarily hurt.<br /><br />If you don't think you can load the trays properly, then maybe the strip kind is for you. They come prepackaged so in that sense it might be easier. For the strips, you should really try hard to use your finger-nails or some type of depression tool (a toothpick would work) to get the whitening gel into the indents of your teeth. I used the strips for a few times and noticed that it wasn't whitening all of my teeth, just the surface that touches the strips. Also if you decide to use the strips you have to really worry about getting the solution on your gums. This can be just as painful as having sensitive teeth. If you can get over these two obstacles, than the strip style solution is not bad. I just like the tray-style because it avoids these two problems.<br /><br />If you want better/faster results and feel like you can follow a simple video guide or a few written instructions, then I would suggest getting a teeth whitening kit that uses trays. If you have perfectly straight teeth and your gums are not sensitive, then the strips might work out just fine. Like my dentist said, try both and see which option works best for you.

So if it's your first time-- you'll still see amazing results if you opt for the lower strength strips.   700. I've been using Crest Whitestrips for years, ever since the original product was released. Crest continues to refine the product, as it becomes more powerful, requires less time, and with better adhesion. I'm at a point now where I just use them for a few days every couple of months for upkeep. Their effect is noticeable, both to me and to friends who comment on how my teeth look whiter. Without regular maintenance, my teeth would be fairly yellow and dull-looking. No, Crest does not give me the blinding, \\"Hollywood-type\\" white, but that's not what I want, anyway. Instead, they look bright, natural, and definitely more white than yellow.<br /><br />Those with sensitive teeth do need to be careful - the first time I used them, I had pain in my teeth after about a week of daily use. I also had some major soreness that lasted for a full day when I dozed off recently one night with the strips in place and woke up three hours later. Completely my fault, but a good reminder to not exceed thirty minutes. I also have some gum recession, and I need to be very careful to not place the strips on my exposed root. But once they're in place, they don't move.<br /><br />Crest has so many variations of Whitestrips now (too many, in my opinion), and it can be difficult to discern the difference between them. I switch between this version and [[ASIN:B00336EUTK Crest 3D White Professional Effects Whitening Strips, 20-Count]]. If there is a truly a difference between the two, it's not enough for me to discern. I just choose one or the other based on availability and sales price. I highly recommend either one.<br /><br />I'm happy enough with Crest that I would not even consider trying another brand.

  710. I got these and tried them for the amount of time suggested. My teeth are noticeably whiter. It doesn't do anything for silver amalgam cavities of course, or any other artificial enhancements on your teeth. The strips stick pretty decently. I had no peeling troubles. Whitening your own teeth is easy, if a bit awkward. Still, it's way cheaper than the dentist by a bit.<br /><br />While I liked them, the effects aren't permanent. Any strong colored foods that stained your teeth before will again. Also, I had quite a bit of sensitivity to them, so I ended up using them less. Your mileage may vary there, though, as everyone's mouth is different.<br /><br />It's certainly worth trying these before heading to the dentist. If they work, you save quite a bit of money.
  711. I got halfway through the box and found myself reluctant to continue. It's not the product - these do work as stated. My teeth became noticeably whiter in a few days. The issue was consistency.<br /><br />These have to stay on for a minimum of 30 minutes over the course of 14 days. They do stay on really well, which I found surprising. The adhesive in these is very effective. The application is easy to do. It's just that you have to keep doing it.<br /><br />The taste is not an issue - it taste like hydrogen peroxide. It's simply the hassle of having to find 30 minutes in the day to apply these, and then reapply them every day for two solid weeks. It's almost like taking a medication. You have to complete the routine or else the effectiveness is not optimal.<br /><br />According to the instructions, you can double up and do two applications in one day. I have not tried that. My teeth are semi sensitive after completing seven days of the routine. I just wish I could get results in less time.

I noticed my teeth color changed after the 3rd day! I have not finished the entire strips because I noticed a slightly sensitivity after using it 5 or 6 times. This can be totally caused by other reasons but I am just being careful so I use it every 2 or 3 days.<br />The Crest Advanced Vivid Whitening Strips include 14 sets - 1 upper and 1 lower strip in each set. They cover most of the teeth that will show when you smile (incisors and canines), not more. They are long enough to slightly fold to the back sides of teeth but not cover much of the back teeth either. I miss the old whitening strips I used (more than 5 years ago) that are much larger coverage. But based on my partner's experience, the old strips did not stay on his teeth, but this one does. They are pretty strongly glued to my teeth, which personally I don't like that feeling, but I have no problems of taking them off either.

  874. I first purchased the Classic Crest Whitestrips my senior year of high school in 2003 when the product first became popular and I found out I had won \\"Best Smile\\" for my senior class. This meant having my photo taken for a special page in the year book. We couldn't afford to have it done professionally so, my parents decided to buy the pack for me to give it a try. I couldn't believe the result and how much it worked. Everyone noticed, I received compliments everywhere I went by so many people over how perfectly white my teeth were. The original pack was a 30 minute a day, 14 day treatment. In that one year, I used just one box of the crest whitestrips. Nearly ten years later, I'm 28 years old and my teeth are STILL as perfectly white as they were when I first tried it. I get asked all the time if I get them professionally whitened and no one believes me when I say I used the whitestrips ten years ago. The only downside is that I am a little sensitive to ice now. It's not enough to where it's unbearable but it is a little annoying. I've been to the dentist several times since using the strips and I've been told that my teeth have not been harmed by the product, just some people can have different reactions to them. I haven't used the newest Crest whitening products but, I can imagine they work just as well if all they've done is improve the formula and adhesive strips. I would recommend this to anyone! I've been telling people for years to use this stuff, it honestly works.

I am not a heavy coffee drinker but I do drink a lot of tea and occasionally smoke cigars. I pretty much never drink soda though so depending on your diet you might have different results.<br /><br />I did a bit of research and from my reading I am under the impression that these strips don't harm your teeth or make them more susceptible to stains after use, as some rumors might have you believe. I use my fingernail to push them in between the teeth good once they're on. That way the whitening effect gets the whole tooth not just on the surface on the front. I watch TV or finish up on the computer for 30 minutes and remove them. I rub my teeth with tissue to get off the excess residue and then rinse. Voila! I didn't give them a 5 rating because you do have to do it regularly; it's not 3 shades instantly.

  973. I have used Crest products for many years but I haven't used whitening strips in several. The whitening power scale is very helpful, these level 3 strips had good power but didn't give me any sensitivity whatsoever. The Advanced Seal Technology is amazing... the strips no longer slip and slide around on your teeth, seep whitening liquid into your mouth, OR make you drool like crazy. I could go about my normal day with these on for just 30 minutes for two weeks.<br /><br />Overall I highly recommend these strips and also suggest buying them here on Amazon as I haven't been able to find a better price in any store (Safeway, Rite-Aid, Fred Meyer etc...).
